text: In the beginning God created the heaven and the earth.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the earth was without form and void, and darkness was upon the deep, and the Spirit of God moved upon the waters.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then God said, Let there be light: And there was light.
speaker: God

text: And God saw the light that it was good, and God separated the light from the darkness.
speaker: Narrator

text: And God called the Light, Day, and the darkness he called Night. So the evening and the morning were the first day.
speaker: Narrator

text: Again God said, Let there be a firmament in the midst of the waters, and let it separate the waters from the waters.
speaker: God

text: Then God made the firmament, and separated the waters, which were under the firmament, from the waters which were above the firmament: and it was so.
speaker: Narrator

text: And God called the firmament, Heaven. So the evening and the morning were the second day.
speaker: Narrator

text: God said again, Let the waters under the heaven be gathered into one place, and let the dry land appear: and it was so.
speaker: God

text: And God called the dry land, Earth, and he called the gathering together of the waters, Seas: and God saw that it was good.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then God said, Let the earth bud forth the bud of the herb, that seedeth seed, the fruitful tree, which beareth fruit according to his kind, which hath his seed in itself upon the earth: and it was so.
speaker: God

text: And the earth brought forth the bud of the herb, that seedeth seed according to his kind, also the tree that beareth fruit, which hath his seed in itself according to his kind: and God saw that it was good.
speaker: Narrator

text: So the evening and the morning were the third day.
speaker: Narrator

text: And God said, Let there be lights in the firmament of the heaven, to separate the day from the night, and let them be for signs, and for seasons, and for days, and years.
speaker: God

text: And let them be for lights in the firmament of the heaven to give light upon the earth: and it was so.
speaker: Narrator

text: God then made two great lights: the greater light to rule the day, and the lesser light to rule the night: he made also the stars.
speaker: Narrator

text: And God set them in the firmament of the heaven, to shine upon the earth,
speaker: Narrator

text: And to rule in the day, and in the night, and to separate the light from the darkness: and God saw that it was good.
speaker: Narrator

text: So the evening and the morning were the fourth day.
speaker: Narrator

text: Afterward God said, Let the waters bring forth in abundance every creeping thing that hath life: and let the fowl fly upon the earth in the open firmament of the heaven.
speaker: God

text: Then God created the great whales, and everything living and moving, which the waters brought forth in abundance according to their kind, and every feathered fowl according to his kind: and God saw that it was good.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then God blessed them, saying, Bring forth fruit and multiply, and fill the waters in the seas, and let the fowl multiply in the earth.
speaker: God

text: So the evening and the morning were the fifth day.
speaker: Narrator

text: Moreover God said, Let the earth bring forth the living thing according to his kind, cattle, and that which creepeth, and the beast of the earth according to his kind, and it was so.
speaker: God

text: And God made the beast of the earth according to his kind, and the cattle according to his kind, and every creeping thing of the earth according to his kind: and God saw that it was good.
speaker: Narrator

text: Furthermore God said, Let us make man in our image according to our likeness, and let them rule over the fish of the sea, and over the fowl of the heaven, and over the beasts, and over all the earth, and over everything that creepeth and moveth on the earth.
speaker: God

text: Thus God created the man in his image: in the image of God created he him: he created them male and female.
speaker: Narrator

text: And God blessed them, and God said to them, Bring forth fruit, and multiply, and fill the earth, and subdue it, and rule over the fish of the sea, and over the fowl of the heaven, and over every beast that moveth upon the earth.
speaker: God

text: And God said, Behold, I have given unto you every herb bearing seed, which is upon all the earth, and every tree, wherein is the fruit of a tree bearing seed: that shall be to you for meat.
speaker: God

text: Likewise to every beast of the earth, and to every fowl of the heaven, and to everything that moveth upon the earth, which hath life in itself, every green herb shall be for meat, and it was so.
speaker: God

text: And God saw all that he had made, and lo, it was very good. So the evening and the morning were the sixth day.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thus the heavens and the earth were finished, and all the host of them.
speaker: Narrator

text: For in the seventh day God ended his work which he had made, and the seventh day he rested from all his work, which he had made.
speaker: Narrator

text: So God blessed the seventh day, and sanctified it, because that in it he had rested from all his work, which God created and made.
speaker: Narrator

text: These are the generations of the heavens and of the earth, when they were created, in the day, that the Lord God made the earth and the heavens,
speaker: Narrator

text: And every plant of the field, before it was in the earth, and every herb of the field, before it grew, for the Lord God had not caused it to rain upon the earth, neither was there a man to till the ground,
speaker: Narrator

text: But a mist went up from the earth, and watered all the earth.
speaker: Narrator

text: The Lord God also made the man of the dust of the ground, and breathed in his face breath of life, and the man was a living soul.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the Lord God planted a garden Eastward in Eden, and there he put the man whom he had made.
speaker: Narrator

text: (For out of the ground made the Lord God to grow every tree pleasant to the sight, and good for meat: the tree of life also in the midst of the garden, and the tree of knowledge of good and of evil.
speaker: Narrator

text: And out of Eden went a river to water the garden, and from thence it was divided, and became into four heads.
speaker: Narrator

text: The name of one is Pishon: the same compasseth the whole land of Havilah, where is gold.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the gold of that land is good: there is Bdellium, and the Onyx stone.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the name of the second river is Gihon: the same compasseth the whole land of Cush.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the name of the [third] river is Hiddekel: this goeth toward the East side of Ashshur: and the fourth river is Parah)
speaker: Narrator

text: Then the Lord God took the man, and put him into the garden of Eden, that he might dress it, and keep it.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the Lord God commanded the man, saying, Thou shalt eat freely of every tree of the garden,
speaker: God

text: But of the tree of knowledge of good and evil, thou shalt not eat of it: for in the day that thou eatest thereof, thou shalt die the death.
speaker: God

text: Also the Lord God said, It is not good that the man should be himself alone: I will make him an help meet for him.
speaker: God

text: So the Lord God formed of the earth every beast of the field, and every fowl of the heaven, and brought them unto the man to see how he would call them: for howsoever the man named the living creature, so was the name thereof.
speaker: Narrator

text: The man therefore gave names unto all cattle, and to the fowl of the heaven, and to every beast of the field: but for Adam found he not an helper meet for him.
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore the Lord God caused an heavy sleep to fall upon the man, and he slept: and he took one of his ribs, and closed up the flesh in stead thereof.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the rib which the Lord God had taken from the man, made he a woman, and brought her to the man.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then the man said, This now is bone of my bones, and flesh of my flesh. She shall be called woman, because she was taken out of the man.
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore shall man leave his father and his mother, and shall cleave to his wife, and they shall be one flesh.
speaker: Narrator

text: And they were both naked, the man and his wife, and they were not ashamed.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now the serpent was more subtle than any beast of the field, which the Lord God had made: and he said to the woman, Yea, hath God indeed said, ye shall not eat of every tree of the garden?
speaker: Narrator

text: And the woman said unto the serpent, We eat of the fruit of the trees of the garden.
speaker: Narrator

text: But of the fruit of the tree which is in the midst of the garden, God hath said, Ye shall not eat of it, neither shall ye touch it, lest ye die.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then the serpent said to the woman, Ye shall not die at all,
speaker: Narrator

text: But God doth know that when ye shall eat thereof, your eyes shall be opened, and ye shall be as gods, knowing good and evil.
speaker: Narrator

text: So the woman (seeing that the tree was good for meat, and that it was pleasant to the eyes, and a tree to be desired, to get knowledge) took of the fruit thereof, and did eat, and gave also to her husband with her, and he did eat.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then the eyes of them both were opened, and they knew that they were naked, and they sewed fig tree leaves together, and made themselves breeches.
speaker: Narrator

text: Afterward they heard the voice of the Lord God walking in the garden in the cool of the day, and the man and his wife hid themselves from the presence of the Lord God among the trees of the garden.
speaker: Narrator

text: But the Lord God called to the man, and said unto him, Where art thou?
speaker: God

text: Who said, I heard thy voice in the garden and was afraid: because I was naked, therefore I hid myself.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he said, Who told thee that thou wast naked? Hast thou eaten of the tree whereof I commanded thee that thou shouldest not eat?
speaker: God

text: Then the man said, The woman which thou gavest to be with me, she gave me of the tree, and I did eat.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the Lord God said to the woman, Why hast thou done this? And the woman said, The serpent beguiled me, and I did eat.
speaker: God

text: Then the Lord God said to the serpent, Because thou hast done this, thou art cursed above all cattle, and above every beast of the field: upon thy belly shalt thou go, and dust shalt thou eat all the days of thy life.
speaker: God

text: I will also put enmity between thee and the woman, and between thy seed and her seed. He shall break thine head, and thou shalt bruise his heel.
speaker: God

text: Unto the woman he said, I will greatly increase thy sorrows, and thy conceptions. In sorrow shalt thou bring forth children, and thy desire shall be subject to thine husband, and he shall rule over thee.
speaker: God

text: Also to Adam he said, Because thou hast obeyed the voice of thy wife, and hast eaten of the tree, (whereof I commanded thee, saying, Thou shalt not eat of it) cursed is the earth for thy sake: in sorrow shalt thou eat of it all the days of thy life.
speaker: God

text: Thorns also and thistles shall it bring forth to thee, and thou shalt eat the herb of the field.
speaker: Narrator

text: In the sweat of thy face shalt thou eat bread till thou return to the earth: for out of it wast thou taken, because thou art dust, and to dust shalt thou return.
speaker: God

text: (And the man called his wife’s name Eve, because she was the mother of all living)
speaker: Narrator

text: Unto Adam also and to his wife did the Lord God make coats of skins, and clothed them.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the Lord God said, Behold, the man is become as one of us, to know good and evil. And now lest he put forth his hand, and take also of the tree of life, and eat, and live forever,
speaker: God

text: Therefore the Lord God sent him forth from the garden of Eden, to till the earth, whence he was taken.
speaker: God

text: Thus he cast out the man, and at the East side of the garden of Eden he set the Cherubims, and the blade of a sword shaken, to keep the way of the tree of life.
speaker: Narrator

text: Afterward the man knew Eve his wife which conceived and bare Cain, and said, I have obtained a man by the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: And again she brought forth his brother Abel, and Abel was a keeper of sheep, and Cain was a tiller of the ground.
speaker: Narrator

text: And in process of time it came to pass, that Cain brought an oblation unto the Lord of the fruit of the ground.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Abel also himself brought of the firstfruits of his sheep, and of the fat of them, and the Lord had respect unto Abel, and to his offering,
speaker: Narrator

text: But unto Cain and to his offering he had no regard: wherefore Cain was exceedingly wroth and his countenance fell down.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then the Lord said unto Cain, Why art thou wroth? and why is thy countenance cast down?
speaker: Narrator

text: If thou do well, shalt thou not be accepted? and if thou doest not well, sin lieth at the door: also unto thee his desire shall be subject, and thou shalt rule over him.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Cain spake unto Abel his brother. And when they were in the field, Cain rose up against Abel his brother, and slew him.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then the Lord said unto Cain, Where is Abel thy brother? Who answered, I cannot tell. Am I my brother’s keeper?
speaker: Narrator

text: Again he said, What hast thou done? the voice of thy brother’s blood crieth unto me, from the earth.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now therefore thou art cursed from the earth, which hath opened her mouth to receive thy brother’s blood from thine hand.
speaker: Narrator

text: When thou shalt till the ground, it shall not henceforth yield unto thee her strength: a vagabond and a runagate shalt thou be in the earth.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Cain said to the Lord, My punishment is greater than I can bear.
speaker: Narrator

text: Behold, thou hast cast me out this day from the earth, and from thy face shall I be hid, and shall be a vagabond, and a runagate in the earth, and whosoever findeth me shall slay me.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then the Lord said unto him, Doubtless whosoever slayeth Cain, he shall be punished seven fold. And the Lord set a mark upon Cain, lest any man finding him, should kill him.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Cain went out from the presence of the Lord, and dwelt in the land of Nod toward the East side of Eden.
speaker: Narrator

text: Cain also knew his wife, which conceived and bore Enoch: and he built a city, and called the name of the city by the name of his son, Enoch.
speaker: Narrator

text: And to Enoch was born Irad, and Irad begat Mehujael, and Mehujael begat Methushael, and Methushael begat Lamech.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Lamech took to him two wives: the name of the one was Adah, and the name of the other Zillah.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Adah bare Jabal, who was the father of such as dwell in the tents, and of such as have cattle.
speaker: Narrator

text: And his brother’s name was Jubal, who was the father of all that play on the harp and organs.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Zillah also bore Tubal-Cain, who wrought cunningly every craft of brass and of iron: and the sister of Tubal-Cain was Naamah.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Lamech said unto his wives, Adah and Zillah, Hear my voice, ye wives of Lamech; hearken unto my speech: for I would slay a man in my wound, and a young man to mine hurt.
speaker: Narrator

text: If Cain shall be avenged sevenfold, truly Lamech seventy times sevenfold.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Adam knew his wife again, and she bare a son, and she called his name Seth: for God, said she, hath appointed me another seed for Abel, because Cain slew him.
speaker: Narrator

text: And to the same Seth also there was born a son, and he called his name Enosh. Then began men to call upon the name of the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: This is the book of the generations of Adam. In the day that God created Adam, in the likeness of God made he him,
speaker: Narrator

text: Male and female created he them, and blessed them, and called their name Adam in the day that they were created.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now Adam lived an hundred and thirty years, and begat a child in his own likeness after his image, and called his name Seth.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the days of Adam, after he had begotten Seth, were eight hundred years, and he begat sons and daughters.
speaker: Narrator

text: So all the days that Adam lived, were nine hundred and thirty years, and he died.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Seth lived an hundred and five years, and begat Enosh.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Seth lived after he begat Enosh, eight hundred and seven years, and begat sons and daughters.
speaker: Narrator

text: So all the days of Seth were nine hundred and twelve years: and he died.
speaker: Narrator

text: Also Enosh lived ninety years, and begat Cainan.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Enosh lived after he begat Cainan, eight hundred and fifteen years, and begat sons and daughters.
speaker: Narrator

text: So all the days of Enosh were nine hundred and five years: and he died.
speaker: Narrator

text: Likewise Cainan lived seventy years, and begat Mahalalel.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Cainan lived, after he begat Mahalalel, eight hundred and forty years, and begat sons and daughters.
speaker: Narrator

text: So all the days of Cainan were nine hundred and ten years: and he died.
speaker: Narrator

text: Mahalalel also lived sixty and five years, and begat Jared.
speaker: Narrator

text: Also Mahalalel lived, after he begat Jared, eight hundred and thirty years, and begat sons and daughters.
speaker: Narrator

text: So all the days of Mahalalel were eight hundred ninety and five years: and he died.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Jared lived an hundred sixty and two years, and begat Enoch.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Jared lived, after he begat Enoch, eight hundred years, and begat sons and daughters.
speaker: Narrator

text: So all the days of Jared were nine hundred sixty and two years: and he died.
speaker: Narrator

text: Also Enoch lived sixty and five years, and begat Methuselah.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Enoch walked with God, after he begat Methuselah, three hundred years, and begat sons and daughters.
speaker: Narrator

text: So all the days of Enoch were three hundred sixty and five years.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Enoch walked with God, and he was no more seen: for God took him away.
speaker: Narrator

text: Methuselah also lived an hundred eighty and seven years, and begat Lamech.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Methuselah lived, after he begat Lamech, seven hundred eighty and two years, and begat sons and daughters.
speaker: Narrator

text: So all the days of Methuselah were nine hundred sixty and nine years, and he died.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Lamech lived an hundred eighty and two years, and begat a son,
speaker: Narrator

text: And called his name, Noah, saying, This same shall comfort us concerning our work and sorrow of our hands, as touching the earth, which the Lord hath cursed.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Lamech lived, after he begat Noah, five hundred ninety and five years, and begat sons and daughters.
speaker: Narrator

text: So all the days of Lamech were seven hundred seventy and seven years: and he died.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Noah was five hundred years old. And Noah begat Shem, Ham and Japheth.
speaker: Narrator

text: So when men began to be multiplied upon the earth, and there were daughters born unto them,
speaker: Narrator

text: Then the sons of God saw the daughters of men that they were fair, and they took them wives of all that they liked.
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore the Lord said, My spirit shall not always strive with man, because he is but flesh, and his days shall be an hundred and twenty years.
speaker: Narrator

text: There were giants in the earth in those days: yea, and after that the sons of God came unto the daughters of men, and they had borne them children, these were mighty men, which in old time were men of renown.
speaker: Narrator

text: When the Lord saw that the wickedness of man was great in the earth, and all the imaginations of the thoughts of his heart were only evil continually,
speaker: Narrator

text: Then it repented the Lord, that he had made man in the earth, and he was sorry in his heart.
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore the Lord said, I will destroy from the earth the man, whom I have created, from man to beast, to the creeping thing, and to the fowl of the heaven: for I repent that I have made them.
speaker: Narrator

text: But Noah found grace in the eyes of the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: These are the generations of Noah: Noah was a just and upright man in his time: and Noah walked with God.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Noah begat three sons, Shem, Ham and Japheth.
speaker: Narrator

text: The earth also was corrupt before God: for the earth was filled with cruelty.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then God looked upon the earth, and behold, it was corrupt: for all flesh had corrupted his way upon the earth.
speaker: Narrator

text: And God said unto Noah, An end of all flesh is come before me: for the earth is filled with cruelty through them: and behold, I will destroy them with the earth.
speaker: Narrator

text: Make thee an Ark of pine trees: thou shalt make cabins in the Ark, and shalt pitch it within and without with pitch.
speaker: Narrator

text: And thus shalt thou make it: the length of the Ark shall be three hundred cubits, the breadth of it fifty cubits, and the height of it thirty cubits.
speaker: Narrator

text: A window shalt thou make in the Ark, and in a cubit shalt thou finish it above, and the door of the Ark shalt thou set in the side thereof: thou shalt make it with the low, second, and third room.
speaker: Narrator

text: And I, behold, I will bring a flood of waters upon the earth to destroy all flesh, wherein is the breath of life under heaven: all that is in the earth shall perish.
speaker: Narrator

text: But with thee will I establish my covenant, and thou shalt go into the Ark, thou, and thy sons, and thy wife, and thy sons’ wives with thee.
speaker: Narrator

text: And of every living thing of all flesh two of every sort shalt thou cause to come into the Ark, to keep them alive with thee: they shall be male and female.
speaker: Narrator

text: Of the fowls, after their kind, and of the cattle after their kind, of every creeping thing of the earth after his kind, two of every sort shall come unto thee, that thou mayest keep them alive.
speaker: Narrator

text: And take thou with thee of all meat that is eaten: and thou shalt gather it to thee, that it may be meat for thee and for them.
speaker: Narrator

text: Noah therefore did according unto all that God commanded him: even so did he.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the Lord said unto Noah, Enter thou and all thine house into the Ark: for thee have I seen righteous before me in this age.
speaker: Narrator

text: Of every clean beast thou shalt take to thee by sevens, the male and his female: but of unclean beasts by couples, the male and his female.
speaker: Narrator

text: Of the fowls also of the heaven by sevens, male and female, to keep seed alive upon the whole earth.
speaker: Narrator

text: For seven days hence I will cause it rain upon the earth forty days, and forty nights, and all the substance that I have made, will I destroy from off the earth.
speaker: Narrator

text: Noah therefore did according to all that the Lord commanded him.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Noah was six hundred years old, when the flood of waters was upon the earth.
speaker: Narrator

text: So Noah entered and his sons, and his wife, and his sons’ wives with him into the Ark, because of the waters of the flood.
speaker: Narrator

text: Of the clean beasts, and of the unclean beasts, and of the fowls, and of all that creepeth upon the earth,
speaker: Narrator

text: There came two and two unto Noah into the Ark, male and female, as God had commanded Noah.
speaker: Narrator

text: And so after seven days, the waters of the flood were upon the earth.
speaker: Narrator

text: In the six hundredth year of Noah’s life, in the second month, the seventeenth day of the month, in the same day were all the fountains of the great deep broken up, and the windows of heaven were opened,
speaker: Narrator

text: And the rain was upon the earth forty days and forty nights.
speaker: Narrator

text: In the selfsame day entered Noah with Shem, and Ham and Japheth, the sons of Noah, and Noah’s wife, and the three wives of his sons with them into the Ark.
speaker: Narrator

text: They and every beast after his kind, and all cattle after their kind, and everything that creepeth and moveth upon the earth after his kind, and every fowl after his kind, even every bird of every feather.
speaker: Narrator

text: For they came to Noah into the Ark, two and two, of all flesh wherein is the breath of life.
speaker: Narrator

text: And they entering in, came male and female of all flesh, as God had commanded him: and the Lord shut him in.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then the flood was forty days upon the earth, and the waters were increased, and bare up the Ark, which was lifted up above the earth.
speaker: Narrator

text: The waters also waxed strong, and were increased exceedingly upon the earth, and the Ark went upon the waters.
speaker: Narrator

text: The waters prevailed so exceedingly upon the earth, that all the high mountains, that are under the whole heaven, were covered.
speaker: Narrator

text: Fifteen cubits upward did the waters prevail, when the mountains were covered.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then all flesh perished that moved upon the earth, both fowl and cattle and beast, and everything that creepeth and moveth upon the earth, and every man.
speaker: Narrator

text: Everything in whose nostrils the spirit of life did breathe, whatsoever they were in the dry land, they died.
speaker: Narrator

text: So he destroyed everything that was upon the earth, from man to beast, to the creeping thing, and to the fowl of the heaven: they were even destroyed from the earth. And Noah only remained, and they that were with him in the Ark.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the waters prevailed upon the earth an hundred and fifty days.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now God remembered Noah and every beast, and all the cattle that were with him in the Ark: therefore God made a wind to pass upon the earth, and the waters ceased.
speaker: Narrator

text: The fountains also of the deep and the windows of heaven were stopped, and the rain from heaven was restrained.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the waters returned from above the earth, going and returning: and after the end of the hundred and fiftieth day the waters abated.
speaker: Narrator

text: And in the seventh month, in the seventeenth day of the month, the Ark rested upon the mountains of Ararat.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the waters were going and decreasing until the tenth month: in the tenth month, and in the first day of the month, were the tops of the mountains seen.
speaker: Narrator

text: So after forty days, Noah opened the window of the Ark which he had made,
speaker: Narrator

text: And sent forth a raven, which went out, going forth and returning, until the waters were dried up upon the earth.
speaker: Narrator

text: Again he sent a dove from him, that he might see if the waters were diminished from off the earth.
speaker: Narrator

text: But the dove found no rest for the sole of her foot: therefore she returned unto him into the Ark (for the waters were upon the whole earth) and he put forth his hand, and received her, and took her to him into the Ark.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he abode yet another seven days, and again he sent forth the dove out of the Ark.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the dove came to him in the evening, and lo in her mouth was an olive leaf that she had plucked: whereby Noah knew that the waters were abated from off the earth.
speaker: Narrator

text: Notwithstanding, he waited yet another seven days, and sent forth the dove, which returned not again unto him anymore.
speaker: Narrator

text: And in the six hundred and one year, in the first day of the first month, the waters were dried up from off the earth: and Noah removed the covering of the Ark, and looked, and behold, the upper part of the ground was dry.
speaker: Narrator

text: And in the second month, in the seven and twentieth day of the month, was the earth dry.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then God spake to Noah, saying,
speaker: Narrator

text: Go forth of the Ark, thou, and thy wife, and thy sons, and thy sons’ wives with thee.
speaker: Narrator

text: Bring forth with thee every beast that is with thee, of all flesh, both fowl and cattle, and everything that creepeth and moveth upon the earth, that they may breed abundantly in the earth, and bring forth fruit and increase upon the earth.
speaker: Narrator

text: So Noah came forth, and his sons, and his wife, and his sons’ wives with him.
speaker: Narrator

text: Every beast, every creeping thing, and every fowl, all that moveth upon the earth, after their kinds, went out of the Ark.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Noah built an altar to the Lord, and took of every clean beast, and of every clean fowl, and offered burnt offerings upon the altar.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the Lord smelled a savor of rest, and the Lord said in his heart, I will henceforth curse the ground no more for man’s cause: for the imagination of man’s heart is evil, even from his youth: neither will I smite anymore all things living, as I have done.
speaker: Narrator

text: Hereafter seed time and harvest, and cold and heat, and Summer and Winter, and day and night shall not cease, so long as the earth remaineth.
speaker: Narrator

text: And God blessed Noah and his sons, and said to them, Bring forth fruit, and multiply, and replenish the earth.
speaker: Narrator

text: Also the fear of you, and the dread of you shall be upon every beast of the earth, and upon every fowl of the heaven, upon all that moveth on the earth, and upon all the fishes of the sea: into your hand are they delivered.
speaker: Narrator

text: Everything that moveth and liveth, shall be meat for you: as the green herb, have I given you all things.
speaker: Narrator

text: But flesh with the life thereof, I mean, with the blood thereof, shall ye not eat.
speaker: Narrator

text: For surely I will require your blood, wherein your lives are: at the hands of every beast will I require it: and at the hand of man, even at the hand of a man’s brother will I require the life of man.
speaker: Narrator

text: Who so sheddeth man’s blood, by man shall his blood be shed: for in the image of God hath he made man.
speaker: Narrator

text: But bring ye forth fruit and multiply: grow plentifully in the earth, and increase therein.
speaker: Narrator

text: God spake also to Noah and to his sons with him, saying,
speaker: Narrator

text: Behold, I, even I establish my covenant with you, and with your seed after you,
speaker: Narrator

text: And with every living creature that is with you, with the fowl, with the cattle, and with every beast of the earth with you, from all that go out of the Ark, unto every beast of the earth.
speaker: Narrator

text: And my covenant will I establish with you, that from henceforth all flesh shall not be rooted out by the waters of the flood, neither shall there be a flood to destroy the earth anymore.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then God said, This is the token of the covenant which I make between me and you, and between every living thing that is with you unto perpetual generations.
speaker: Narrator

text: I have set my bow in the cloud, and it shall be for a sign of the covenant between me and the earth.
speaker: Narrator

text: And when I shall cover the earth with a cloud, and the bow shall be seen in the cloud,
speaker: Narrator

text: Then will I remember my covenant which is between me and you, and between every living thing in all flesh, and there shall be no more waters of a flood to destroy all flesh.
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore the bow shall be in the cloud, that I may see it, and remember the everlasting covenant between God and every living thing, in all flesh that is upon the earth.
speaker: Narrator

text: God said yet to Noah, This is the sign of the covenant, which I have established between me and all flesh that is upon the earth.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now the sons of Noah going forth of the Ark, were Shem and Ham and Japheth. And Ham is the father of Canaan.
speaker: Narrator

text: These are the three sons of Noah, and of them was the whole earth overspread.
speaker: Narrator

text: Noah also began to be an husbandman, and planted a vineyard.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he drunk of the wine, and was drunken, and was uncovered in the midst of his tent.
speaker: Narrator

text: And when Ham the father of Canaan saw the nakedness of his father, he told his two brethren without.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then took Shem and Japheth a garment, and put it upon both their shoulders, and went backward and covered the nakedness of their father with their faces backward: so they saw not their father’s nakedness.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Noah awoke from his wine, and knew what his younger son had done unto him,
speaker: Narrator

text: And said, Cursed be Canaan: a servant of servants shall he be unto his brethren.
speaker: Narrator

text: He said moreover, Blessed be the Lord God of Shem, and let Canaan be his servant.
speaker: Narrator

text: God persuade Japheth, that he may dwell in the tents of Shem, and let Canaan be his servant.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Noah lived after the flood three hundred and fifty years.
speaker: Narrator

text: So all the days of Noah were nine hundred and fifty years: and he died.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now these are the generations of the sons of Noah, Shem, Ham and Japheth: unto whom sons were born after the flood.
speaker: Narrator

text: The sons of Japheth were Gomer, and Magog, and Madai, and Javan, and Tubal, and Meshech, and Tiras.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the sons of Gomer, Ashkenaz, and Riphath, and Togarmah.
speaker: Narrator

text: Also the sons of Javan, Elishah and Tarshish, Kittim, and Dodanim.
speaker: Narrator

text: Of these were the isles of the Gentiles divided in their lands, every man after his tongue, and after their families in their nations.
speaker: Narrator

text: Moreover, the sons of Ham were Cush, and Mizraim, and Put, and Canaan.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the sons of Cush, Seba and Havilah, and Sabtah, and Raamah, and Sabtechah: also the sons of Raamah were Sheba and Dedan.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Cush begat Nimrod, who began to be mighty in the earth.
speaker: Narrator

text: He was a mighty hunter before the Lord. Wherefore it is said, As Nimrod the mighty hunter before the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the beginning of his kingdom was Babel and Erech, and Accad, and Calneh, in the land of Shinar.
speaker: Narrator

text: Out of that land came Assyria, and built Nineveh, and the city Rehoboth, and Calah:
speaker: Narrator

text: Resen also between Nineveh and Calah: this is a great city.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Mizraim begat Ludim, and Anamim, and Lehabim, and Naphtuhim.
speaker: Narrator

text: Pathrusim also, and Casluhim (out of whom came the Philistines) and Caphtorims.
speaker: Narrator

text: Also Canaan begat Sidon his firstborn, and Heth,
speaker: Narrator

text: And Jebusi, and Emori, and Girgashi,
speaker: Narrator

text: And Hivi, and Arki, and Sini,
speaker: Narrator

text: And Arvadi, and Zemari, and Hamathi: and afterward were the families of the Canaanites spread abroad.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then the border of the Canaanites was from Sidon, as thou comest to Gerar until Gaza, and as thou goest unto Sodom and Gomorrah, and Admah, and Zeboiim, even unto Lasha.
speaker: Narrator

text: These are the sons of Ham according to their families, according to their tongues in their countries, and in their nations.
speaker: Narrator

text: Unto Shem also the father of all the sons of Eber, and elder brother of Japheth were children born.
speaker: Narrator

text: The sons of Shem were Elam and Asshur, and Arphaxad, and Lud, and Aram.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the sons of Aram, Uz and Hul, and Gether, and Mash.
speaker: Narrator

text: Also Arphaxad begat Salah, and Salah begat Eber.
speaker: Narrator

text: Unto Eber also were born two sons: the name of the one was Peleg: for in his days was the earth divided: and his brother’s name was Joktan.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Joktan begat Almodad, and Sheleph, and Hazarmaveth, and Jerah,
speaker: Narrator

text: And Hadoram, and Uzal, and Diklah,
speaker: Narrator

text: And Obal, and Abimael, and Sheba,
speaker: Narrator

text: And Ophir, and Havilah, and Jobab: all these were the sons of Joktan.
speaker: Narrator

text: And their dwelling was from Mesha, as thou goest up to Sephar, a mount of the East.
speaker: Narrator

text: These are the sons of Shem, according to their families, according to their tongues in their countries and nations.
speaker: Narrator

text: These are the families of the sons of Noah, after their generations among their people: and out of these were the nations divided in the earth after the flood.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then the whole earth was of one language and one speech.
speaker: Narrator

text: And as they went from the East, they found a plain in the land of Shinar, and there they abode.
speaker: Narrator

text: And they said one to another, Come, let us make brick and burn it in the fire, so they had brick for stone, and slime had they instead of mortar.
speaker: Narrator

text: Also they said, Go to, let us build us a city and a tower, whose top may reach unto the heaven, that we may get us a name, lest we be scattered upon the whole earth.
speaker: Narrator

text: But the Lord came down, to see the city and tower which the sons of men built.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the Lord said, Behold, the people is one, and they all have one language, and this they begin to do, neither can they now be stopped from whatsoever they have imagined to do.
speaker: Narrator

text: Come on, let us go down, and there confound their language, that everyone perceive not another’s speech.
speaker: Narrator

text: So the Lord scattered them from thence upon all the earth, and they left off to build the city.
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore the name of it was called Babel, because the Lord did there confound the language of all the earth: from thence then did the Lord scatter them upon all the earth.
speaker: Narrator

text: These are the generations of Shem: Shem was an hundred years old, and begat Arphaxad two years after the flood.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Shem lived after he begat Arphaxad five hundred years, and begat sons and daughters.
speaker: Narrator

text: Also Arphaxad lived five and thirty years, and begat Salah.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Arphaxad lived after he begat Salah, four hundred and three years, and begat sons and daughters.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Salah lived thirty years, and begat Eber.
speaker: Narrator

text: So Salah lived after he begat Eber four hundred and three years, and begat sons and daughters.
speaker: Narrator

text: Likewise Eber lived four and thirty years, and begat Peleg.
speaker: Narrator

text: So Eber lived after he begat Peleg four hundred and thirty years, and begat sons and daughters.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Peleg lived thirty years, and begat Reu.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Peleg lived after he begat Reu two hundred and nine years, and begat sons and daughters.
speaker: Narrator

text: Also Reu lived two and thirty years, and begat Serug.
speaker: Narrator

text: So Reu lived after he begat Serug two hundred and seven years, and begat sons and daughters.
speaker: Narrator

text: Moreover Serug lived thirty years, and begat Nahor.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Serug lived after he begat Nahor two hundred years, and begat sons and daughters.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Nahor lived nine and twenty years, and begat Terah.
speaker: Narrator

text: So Nahor lived after he begat Terah, an hundred and nineteen years, and begat sons and daughters.
speaker: Narrator

text: So Terah lived seventy years, and begat Abram, Nahor, and Haran.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now these are the generations of Terah: Terah begat Abram, Nahor, and Haran: and Haran begat Lot.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Haran died before Terah his father in the land of his nativity, in Ur of the Chaldeans.
speaker: Narrator

text: So Abram and Nahor took them wives. The name of Abram’s wife was Sarai, and the name of Nahor’s wife Milcah, the daughter of Haran, the father of Milcah, and the father of Iscah.
speaker: Narrator

text: But Sarai was barren, and had no child.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Terah took Abram his son, and Lot the son of Haran his son’s son, and Sarai his daughter-in-law, his son Abram’s wife: and they departed together from Ur of the Chaldeans, to go into the land of Canaan, and they came to Haran, and dwelt there.
speaker: Narrator

text: So the days of Terah were two hundred and five years, and Terah died in Haran.
speaker: Narrator

text: For the Lord had said unto Abram, Get thee out of thy country, and from thy kindred, and from thy father’s house unto the land that I will show thee.
speaker: Narrator

text: And I will make of thee a great nation, and will bless thee, and make thy name great, and thou shalt be a blessing.
speaker: Narrator

text: I will also bless them that bless thee, and curse them that curse thee, and in thee shall all families of the earth be blessed.
speaker: Narrator

text: So Abram departed, even as the Lord spake unto him, and Lot went with him, (and Abram was seventy and five years old, when he departed out of Haran)
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Abram took Sarai his wife, and Lot his brother’s son, and all their substance that they possessed, and the souls that they had gotten in Haran, and they departed to go to the land of Canaan, and to the land of Canaan they came.
speaker: Narrator

text: So Abram passed through the land unto the place of Shechem, and unto the plain of Moreh (and the Canaanite was then in the land)
speaker: Narrator

text: And the Lord appeared unto Abram, and said, Unto thy seed will I give this land. And there built he an altar unto the Lord, which appeared unto him.
speaker: Narrator

text: Afterward removing thence unto a mountain Eastward from Bethel, he pitched his tent having Bethel on the West side, and Ai on the East, and there he built an altar unto the Lord, and called on the Name of the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: Again Abram went forth going and journeying toward the South.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then there came a famine in the land: therefore Abram went down into Egypt to sojourn there: for there was a great famine in the land.
speaker: Narrator

text: And when he drew near to enter into Egypt, he said to Sarai his wife, Behold now, I know that thou art a fair woman to look upon:
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore it will come to pass that when the Egyptians see thee, they will say, She is his wife: so will they kill me, but they will keep thee alive.
speaker: Narrator

text: Say, I pray thee, that thou art my sister, that I may fare well for thy sake, and that my life may be preserved by thee.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now when Abram was come into Egypt, the Egyptians beheld the woman: for she was very fair.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the Princes of Pharaoh saw her, and commended her unto Pharaoh: so the woman was taken into Pharaoh’s house:
speaker: Narrator

text: Who entreated Abram well for her sake, and he had sheep, and beeves, and he asses, and menservants, and maidservants, and she asses, and camels.
speaker: Narrator

text: But the Lord plagued Pharaoh and his house with great plagues, because of Sarai Abram’s wife.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Pharaoh called Abram, and said, Why hast thou done this unto me? Wherefore diddest thou not tell me, that she was thy wife?
speaker: Narrator

text: Why saidest thou, She is my sister, that I should take her to be my wife? Now therefore behold thy wife, take her and go thy way.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Pharaoh gave men commandment concerning him: and they conveyed him forth and his wife, and all that he had.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Abram went up from Egypt, he and his wife, and all that he had, and Lot with him toward the South.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Abram was very rich in cattle, in silver and in gold.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he went on his journey from the South toward Bethel, to the place where his tent had been at the beginning, between Bethel and Ai,
speaker: Narrator

text: Unto the place of the altar, which he had made there at the first: and there Abram called on the Name of the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Lot also, who went with Abram, had sheep, and cattle and tents,
speaker: Narrator

text: So that the land could not bear them, that they might dwell together: for their substance was great, so that they could not dwell together.
speaker: Narrator

text: Also there was debate between the herdsmen of Abram’s cattle, and the herdsmen of Lot’s cattle, (and the Canaanites and the Perizzites dwelleth at that time in the land.)
speaker: Narrator

text: Then said Abram unto Lot, Let there be no strife, I pray thee, between thee and me, neither between mine herdsmen and thine herdsmen: for we be brethren.
speaker: Narrator

text: Is not the whole land before thee? depart I pray thee from me: if thou wilt take the left hand, then I will go to the right: or if thou go to the right hand, then I will take the left.
speaker: Narrator

text: So when Lot lifted up his eyes, he saw that all the plain of Jordan was watered everywhere (for before the Lord destroyed Sodom and Gomorrah, it was as the garden of the Lord like the land of Egypt, as thou goest unto Zoar.)
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Lot chose unto him all the plain of Jordan, and took his journey from the East: and they departed the one from the other.
speaker: Narrator

text: Abram dwelled in the land of Canaan, and Lot abode in the cities of the plain, and pitched his tent even unto Sodom.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now the men of Sodom were wicked and exceeding sinners against the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then the Lord said unto Abram, (after that Lot was departed from him) Lift up thine eyes now, and look from the place where thou art, Northward, and Southward, and Eastward, and Westward:
speaker: Narrator

text: For all the land which thou seest, will I give unto thee, and to thy seed forever,
speaker: Narrator

text: And I will make thy seed as the dust of the earth: so that if a man can number the dust of the earth, then shall thy seed be numbered.
speaker: Narrator

text: Arise, walk through the land, in the length thereof, and breadth thereof: for I will give it unto thee.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Abram removed his tent, and came and dwelled in the plain of Mamre, which is in Hebron, and built there an altar unto the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: And in the days of Amraphel king of Shinar, Arioch king of Ellasar, Chedorlaomer king of Elam, and Tidal king of the nations:
speaker: Narrator

text: These men made war with Bera king of Sodom, and with Birsha king of Gomorrah, Shinab king of Admah, and Shemeber king of Zeboiim, and the king of Bela, which is Zoar.
speaker: Narrator

text: All these joined together in the valley of Siddim, which is the salt Sea.
speaker: Narrator

text: Twelve years were they subject to Chedorlaomer, but in the thirteenth year they rebelled.
speaker: Narrator

text: And in the fourteenth year came Chedorlaomer, and the kings that were with him, and smote the Rephaims in Ashteroth Karnaim, and the Zuzims in Ham, and the Emims in Shaveh Kiriathaim,
speaker: Narrator

text: And the Horites in their mount Seir, unto the plain of El Paran, which is by the wilderness.
speaker: Narrator

text: And they returned and came to En Mishpat, which is Kadesh, and smote all the country of the Amalekites, and also the Amorites that dwelled in Hazezon Tamar.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then went out the king of Sodom, and the king of Gomorrah, and the king of Admah, and the king of Zeboiim, and the king of Bela, which is Zoar: and they joined battle with them in the valley of Siddim,
speaker: Narrator

text: To wit, with Chedorlaomer king of Elam, and Tidal king of nations, and Amraphel king of Shinar, and Arioch king of Ellasar: four kings against five.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now the valley of Siddim was full of slime pits, and the kings of Sodom and Gomorrah fled and fell there: and the residue fled to the mountain.
speaker: Narrator

text: And they took all the substance of Sodom and Gomorrah, and all their vittles and went their way.
speaker: Narrator

text: They took Lot also Abram’s brother’s son and his substance (for he dwelt at Sodom) and departed.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then came one that had escaped, and told Abram the Hebrew, which dwelt in the plain of Mamre the Amorite, brother of Eshcol, and brother of Aner, which were confederate with Abram.
speaker: Narrator

text: When Abram heard that his brother was taken, he brought forth of them that were born and brought up in his house, three hundred and eighteen, and pursued them unto Dan.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then he and his servants divided themselves against them by night, and smote them, and pursued them unto Hobah, which is on the left side of Damascus,
speaker: Narrator

text: And he recovered all the substance, and also brought again his brother Lot, and his goods, and the women also and the people.
speaker: Narrator

text: After that he returned from the slaughter of Chedorlaomer and of the kings that were with him, came the King of Sodom forth to meet him in the valley of Shaveh, which is the King’s dale.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Melchizedek King of Salem brought forth bread and wine: and he was a Priest of the most high God.
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore he blessed him, saying, Blessed art thou, Abram, of God most high, Possessor of heaven and earth,
speaker: Narrator

text: And blessed be the most high God, which hath delivered thine enemies into thine hand. And Abram gave him tithes of all.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then the king of Sodom said to Abram, Give me the persons, and take the goods to thyself.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Abram said to the king of Sodom, I have lifted up mine hand unto the Lord the most high God possessor of heaven and earth,
speaker: Narrator

text: That I will not take of all that is thine, so much as a thread or shoe latchet, lest thou shouldest say, I have made Abram rich,
speaker: Narrator

text: Save only that, which the young men have eaten, and the parts of the men which went with me, Aner, Eshcol, and Mamre: let them take their parts.
speaker: Narrator

text: After these things, the word of the Lord came unto Abram in a vision, saying, Fear not, Abram, I am thy buckler, and thine exceeding great reward.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Abram said, O Lord God, what wilt thou give me, seeing I go childless, and the steward of mine house is this Eliezer of Damascus?
speaker: Narrator

text: Again Abram said, Behold, to me thou hast given no seed: wherefore lo, a servant of mine house shall be mine heir.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then behold, the word of the Lord came unto him, saying, This man shall not be thine heir, but one that shall come out of thine own bowels, he shall be thine heir.
speaker: Narrator

text: Moreover he brought him forth and said, Look up now unto heaven, and tell the stars if thou be able to number them: and he said unto him, So shall thy seed be.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Abram believed the Lord, and he counted that to him for righteousness.
speaker: Narrator

text: Again he said unto him, I am the Lord, that brought thee out of Ur, of the Chaldeans, to give thee this land to inherit it.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he said, O Lord God, Whereby shall I know that I shall inherit it?
speaker: Narrator

text: Then he said unto him, Take me an heifer of three years old, and a she goat of three years old, and a ram of three years old, a turtle dove also and a pigeon.
speaker: Narrator

text: So he took all these unto him, and divided them in the midst, and laid every piece one against another: but the birds divided he not.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then fowls fell on the carcasses, and Abram drove them away.
speaker: Narrator

text: And when the sun went down, there fell an heavy sleep unto Abram: and lo, a very fearful darkness fell upon him.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then he said to Abram, Know for a surety, that thy seed shall be a stranger in a land that is not theirs, four hundred years, and shall serve them: and they entreat them evil.
speaker: Narrator

text: Notwithstanding, the nation whom they shall serve, will I judge: and afterward shall they come out with great substance.
speaker: Narrator

text: But thou shalt go unto thy fathers in peace, and shalt be buried in a good age.
speaker: Narrator

text: And in the fourth generation they shall come hither again: for the wickedness of the Amorites is not yet full.
speaker: Narrator

text: Also when the sun went down, there was a darkness: and behold, a smoking furnace, and a firebrand, which went between those pieces.
speaker: Narrator

text: In that same day the Lord made a covenant with Abram, saying, Unto thy seed have I given this land: from the river of Egypt unto the great river Euphrates.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Kenites, and the Kenezzites, and the Kadmonites,
speaker: Narrator

text: And the Hittites, and the Perizzites, and the Rephaims,
speaker: Narrator

text: The Amorites also, and the Canaanites, and the Girgashites, and the Jebusites.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now Sarai Abram’s wife bore him no children, and she had a maid an Egyptian, Hagar by name.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Sarai said unto Abram, Behold now, the Lord hath restrained me from childbearing, I pray thee go in unto my maid: it may be that I shall receive a child by her. And Abram obeyed the voice of Sarai.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Sarai Abram’s wife took Hagar her maid the Egyptian, after Abram had dwelled ten years in the land of Canaan, and gave her to her husband Abram for his wife.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he went in unto Hagar, and she conceived: and when she saw that she had conceived, her dame was despised in her eyes.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Sarai said to Abram, Thou doest me wrong, I have given my maid into thy bosom, and she seeth that she hath conceived, and I am despised in her eyes: the Lord judge between me and thee.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Abram said to Sarai, Behold, thy maid is in thine hand: do with her as it pleaseth thee. Then Sarai dealt roughly with her: wherefore she fled from her.
speaker: Narrator

text: But the Angel of the Lord found her beside a fountain in the way of Shur,
speaker: Narrator

text: And he said, Hagar Sarai’s maid, whence comest thou? and whither wilt thou go? And she said, I flee from my dame Sarai.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then the Angel of the Lord said to her, Return to thy dame, and humble thyself under her hands.
speaker: Narrator

text: Again the Angel of the Lord said unto her, I will so greatly increase thy seed, that it shall not be numbered for multitude.
speaker: Narrator

text: Also the Angel of the Lord said unto her, See, thou art with child, and shalt bear a son, and shalt call his name Ishmael: for the Lord hath heard thy tribulation.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he shall be a wild man: his hand shall be against every man, and every man’s hand against him, and he shall dwell in the presence of all his brethren.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then she called the name of the Lord that spake unto her, Thou God lookest on me: for she said, Have I not also here looked after him that seeth me?
speaker: Narrator

text: Wherefore the Well was called, Beer Lahai Roi: lo, it is between Kadesh and Bered.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Hagar bare Abram a son, and Abram called his son’s name which Hagar bare, Ishmael.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Abram was four score and six years old when Hagar bare him Ishmael.
speaker: Narrator

text: When Abram was ninety years old and nine, the Lord appeared to Abram, and said unto him, I am God all sufficient, walk before me, and be thou upright,
speaker: Narrator

text: And I will make my covenant between me and thee, and I will multiply thee exceedingly.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Abram fell on his face, and God talked with him, saying,
speaker: Narrator

text: Behold, I make my covenant with thee, and thou shalt be a father of many nations,
speaker: Narrator

text: Neither shall thy name anymore be called Abram, but thy name shall be Abraham: for a father of many nations have I made thee.
speaker: Narrator

text: Also I will make thee exceedingly fruitful, and will make nations of thee, yea, Kings shall proceed of thee.
speaker: Narrator

text: Moreover, I will establish my covenant between me and thee, and thy seed after thee in their generations, for an everlasting covenant, to be God unto thee, and to thy seed after thee.
speaker: Narrator

text: And I will give thee and thy seed after thee the land, wherein thou art a stranger, even all the land of Canaan, for an everlasting possession, and I will be their God.
speaker: Narrator

text: Again God said unto Abraham, Thou also shalt keep my covenant, thou, and thy seed after thee in their generations.
speaker: Narrator

text: This is my covenant which ye shall keep between me and you, and thy seed after thee, Let every man-child among you be circumcised:
speaker: Narrator

text: That is, ye shall circumcise the foreskin of your flesh, and it shall be a sign of the covenant between me and you.
speaker: Narrator

text: And every man-child of eight days old among you, shall be circumcised in your generations, as well he that is born in thine house, as he that is bought with money of any stranger, which is not of thy seed.
speaker: Narrator

text: He that is born in thine house, and he that is bought with thy money, must needs be circumcised: so my covenant shall be in your flesh for an everlasting covenant.
speaker: Narrator

text: But the uncircumcised man-child, in whose flesh the foreskin is not circumcised, even that person shall be cut off from his people, because he hath broken my covenant.
speaker: Narrator

text: Afterward God said unto Abraham, Sarai thy wife shalt thou not call Sarai, but Sarah shall be her name.
speaker: Narrator

text: And I will bless her, and will also give thee a son of her, yea, I will bless her, and she shall be the mother of nations: Kings also of people shall come of her.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Abraham fell upon his face, and laughed, and said in his heart, Shall a child be born unto him, that is an hundred years old? and shall Sarah that is ninety years old, bear?
speaker: Narrator

text: And Abraham said unto God, Oh, that Ishmael might live in thy sight.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then God said, Sarah thy wife shall bear thee a son indeed, and thou shalt call his name Isaac: and I will establish my covenant with him for an everlasting covenant, and with his seed after him.
speaker: Narrator

text: And as concerning Ishmael, I have heard thee: lo, I have blessed him, and will make him fruitful, and will multiply him exceedingly: twelve princes shall he beget, and I will make a great nation of him.
speaker: Narrator

text: But my covenant will I establish with Isaac, which Sarah shall bear unto thee, the next year at this season.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he left off talking with him, and God went up from Abraham.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Abraham took Ishmael his son, and all that were born in his house, and all that was bought with his money, that is, every man-child among the men of Abraham’s house, and he circumcised the foreskin of their flesh in that selfsame day, as God had commanded him.
speaker: Narrator

text: Abraham also himself was ninety years old and nine, when the foreskin of his flesh was circumcised.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Ishmael his son was thirteen years old, when the foreskin of his flesh was circumcised.
speaker: Narrator

text: The selfsame day was Abraham circumcised, and Ishmael his son:
speaker: Narrator

text: And all the men of his house both born in his house, and bought with money of the stranger, were circumcised with him.
speaker: Narrator

text: Again the Lord appeared unto him in the plain of Mamre, as he sat in his tent door about the heat of the day.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he lifted up his eyes, and looked: and lo, three men stood by him, and when he saw them, he ran to meet them from the tent door, and bowed himself to the ground.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he said, Lord, if I have now found favor in thy sight, go not, I pray thee, from thy servant.
speaker: Narrator

text: Let a little water, I pray you, be brought, and wash your feet, and rest yourselves under the tree.
speaker: Narrator

text: And I will bring a morsel of bread, that you may comfort your hearts, afterward ye shall go your ways: for therefore are ye come to your servant. And they said, Do even as thou hast said.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Abraham made haste into the tent unto Sarah, and said, Make ready at once three measures of fine meal, knead it, and make cakes upon the hearth.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Abraham ran to the beasts, and took a tender and good calf, and gave it to the servant, who hasted to make it ready.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he took butter and milk, and the calf which he had prepared, and set before them, and stood himself by them under the tree: and they did eat.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then they said unto him, Where is Sarah thy wife? And he answered, Behold, she is in the tent.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he said, I will certainly come again unto thee according to the time of life: and lo, Sarah thy wife shall have a son: and Sarah heard in the tent door, which was behind him.
speaker: Narrator

text: (Now Abraham and Sarah were old and stricken in age, and it ceased to be with Sarah after the manner of women.)
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore Sarah laughed within herself, saying, After I am waxed old, and my lord also, shall I have lust?
speaker: Narrator

text: And the Lord said unto Abraham, Wherefore did Sarah thus laugh, saying, Shall I certainly bear a child, which am old?
speaker: Narrator

text: (Shall anything be hard to the Lord? as the time appointed will I return unto thee, even according to the time of life, and Sarah shall have a son.)
speaker: Narrator

text: But Sarah denied, saying, I laughed not: for she was afraid. And he said, It is not so: for thou laughedst.
speaker: Narrator

text: Afterward, the men did rise up from thence, and looked toward Sodom: and Abraham went with them to bring them on the way.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the Lord said, Shall I hide from Abraham that thing which I do,
speaker: Narrator

text: Seeing that Abraham shall be indeed a great and a mighty nation, and all the nations of the earth shall be blessed in him?
speaker: Narrator

text: For I know him that he will command his sons and his household after him, that they keep the way of the Lord to do righteousness and judgment, that the Lord may bring upon Abraham, that he hath spoken unto him.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then the Lord said, Because the cry of Sodom and Gomorrah is great, and because their sin is exceedingly grievous,
speaker: Narrator

text: I will go down now, and see whether they have done altogether according to that cry, which is come unto me: and if not, that I may know.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the men turned thence, and went toward Sodom: but Abraham stood yet before the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Abraham drew near, and said, Wilt thou also destroy the righteous with the wicked?
speaker: Narrator

text: If there be fifty righteous within the city, wilt thou destroy and not spare the place for the fifty righteous that are therein?
speaker: Narrator

text: Be it far from thee from doing this thing, to slay the righteous with the wicked: and that the righteous should be even as the wicked, be it far from thee. Shall not the Judge of all the world do right?
speaker: Narrator

text: And the Lord answered, If I shall find in Sodom fifty righteous within the city, then will I spare all the place for their sakes.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Abraham answered and said, Behold now, I have begun to speak unto my Lord, and I am but dust and ashes,
speaker: Narrator

text: If there shall lack five of fifty righteous, wilt thou destroy all the city for five? And he said, If I find there five and forty, I will not destroy it.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he yet spake to him again, and said, What if there shall be found forty there? Then he answered, I will not do it for forty’s sake.
speaker: Narrator

text: Again he said, Let not my Lord now be angry that I speak, What if thirty be found there? Then he said, I will not do it, if I find thirty there.
speaker: Narrator

text: Moreover he said, Behold now, I have begun to speak unto my Lord, What if twenty be found there? And he answered, I will not destroy it for twenty’s sake.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then he said, Let not my Lord be now angry, and I will speak but this once, What if ten be found there? And he answered, I will not destroy it for ten’s sake.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the Lord went his way, when he had left communing with Abraham, and Abraham returned unto his place.
speaker: Narrator

text: And in the evening there came two Angels to Sodom: and Lot sat at the gate of Sodom, and Lot saw them, and rose up to meet them, and he bowed himself with his face to the ground.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he said, See my lords, I pray you turn in now into your servant’s house, and tarry all night, and wash your feet, and ye shall rise up early and go your ways. Who said, Nay, but we will abide in the street all night.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then he pressed upon them earnestly, and they turned in to him, and came to his house, and he made them a feast, and did bake unleavened bread, and they did eat.
speaker: Narrator

text: But before they went to bed, the men of the city, even the men of Sodom compassed the house round about, from the young even to the old, all the people from all quarters.
speaker: Narrator

text: Who crying unto Lot said to him, Where are the men, which came to thee this night? bring them out unto us, that we may know them.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Lot went out at the door unto them, and shut the door after him,
speaker: Narrator

text: And said, I pray you, my brethren, do not so wickedly.
speaker: Narrator

text: Behold now, I have two daughters, which have not known man: them will I bring out now unto you, and do them as seemeth you good: only unto these men do nothing: for therefore are they come under the shadow of my roof.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then they said, Away hence: and they said, He is come alone as a stranger, and shall he judge and rule? we will now deal worse with thee than with them. So they pressed sore upon Lot himself, and came to break the door.
speaker: Narrator

text: But the men put forth their hand, and pulled Lot into the house to them, and shut to the door.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then they smote the men that were at the door of the house, with blindness, both small and great, so that they were weary in seeking the door.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then the men said unto Lot, Whom hast thou yet here? either son-in-law, or thy sons or thy daughters, or whatsoever thou hast in the city, bring it out of this place.
speaker: Narrator

text: For we will destroy this place, because the cry of them is great before the Lord, and the Lord hath sent us to destroy it.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Lot went out and spake unto his sons-in-law, which married his daughters, and said, Arise, get you out of this place: for the Lord will destroy the city, but he seemed to his sons-in-law, as though he had mocked.

text: And when the morning arose, the Angels hasted Lot, saying, Arise, take thy wife and thy two daughters which are here, lest thou be destroyed in the punishment of the city.

text: And as he prolonged the time, the men caught both him and his wife, and his two daughters by the hands (the Lord being merciful unto him) and they brought him forth, and set him without the city.
speaker: Narrator

text: And when they had brought them out, the Angel said, Escape for thy life: look not behind thee, neither tarry thou in all the plain: escape into the mountain, lest thou be destroyed.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Lot said unto them, Not so, I pray thee, my Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: Behold now, thy servant hath found grace in thy sight, and thou hast magnified thy mercy, which thou hast showed unto me in saving my life: and I cannot escape in the mountain, lest some evil take me, and I die.
speaker: Narrator

text: See now this city hereby to flee unto, which is a little one: Oh let me escape thither: is it not a little one, and my soul shall live?
speaker: Narrator

text: Then he said unto him, Behold, I have received thy request also concerning this thing, that I will not overthrow this city, for the which thou hast spoken.
speaker: Narrator

text: Haste thee, save thee there: for I can do nothing till thou come thither. Therefore the name of the city was called Zoar.
speaker: Narrator

text: The sun did rise upon the earth, when Lot entered into Zoar.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then the Lord rained upon Sodom and upon Gomorrah, brimstone and fire from the Lord out of heaven,

text: And overthrew those cities, and all the plain, and all the inhabitants of the cities, and that grew upon the earth.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now his wife behind him looked back, and she became a pillar of salt.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Abraham rising up early in the morning went to the place, where he had stood before the Lord,

speaker: Narrator

text: And the elder said unto the younger, Our father is old, and there is not a man in the earth, to come in unto us after the manner of all the earth.

speaker: Narrator

text: And on the morrow the elder said to the younger, Behold, yester night lay I with my father: let us make him drink wine this night also, and go thou and lie with him, that we may preserve seed of our father.
speaker: Narrator

text: So they made their father drink wine that night also, and the younger arose, and lay with him: but he perceived it not, when she lay down, neither when she rose up.
speaker: Narrator

text: Afterward Abraham departed thence toward the South country and dwelled between Kadesh and Shur, and sojourned in Gerar.

speaker: Narrator

text: (Notwithstanding Abimelech had not yet come near her) And he said, Lord, wilt thou slay even the righteous nation?
speaker: Narrator

text: Said not he unto me, She is my sister? yea, and she herself said, He is my brother: with an upright mind, and innocent hands have I done this.
speaker: Narrator

text: And God said unto him by a dream, I know that thou diddest this even with an upright mind, and I kept thee also that thou shouldest not sin against me: therefore suffered I thee not to touch her.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now then deliver the man his wife again: for he is a Prophet, and he shall pray for thee, that thou mayest live: but if thou deliver her not again, be sure that thou shalt die the death, thou, and all that thou hast.

text: Then Abimelech rising up early in the morning, called all his servants, and told all these things unto them, and the men were sore afraid.
speaker: Narrator

text: Afterward Abimelech called Abraham, and said unto him, What hast thou done unto us? and what have I offended thee, that thou hast brought on me, and on my kingdom this great sin? thou hast done things unto me that ought not to be done.

text: So Abimelech said unto Abraham, What sawest thou that thou hast done this thing?
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Abraham answered, Because I thought thus, Surely the fear of God is not in this place, and they will slay me for my wife’s sake.

text: Yet in very deed she is my sister: for she is the daughter of my father, but not the daughter of my mother, and she is my wife.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now when God caused me to wander out of my father’s house, I said then to her, This is thy kindness that thou shalt show unto me in all places where we come, Say thou of me, He is my brother.

text: Then took Abimelech sheep and beeves, and men servants, and women servants, and gave them unto Abraham, and restored him Sarah his wife.

text: And Abimelech said, Behold, my land is before thee, dwell where it pleaseth thee.

text: Likewise to Sarah he said, Behold, I have given thy brother a thousand pieces of silver: behold, he is the veil of thine eyes to all that are with thee, and to all others: and she was thus reproved.

text: Then Abraham prayed unto God, and God healed Abimelech and his wife, and his women servants: and they bare children.

text: For the Lord had shut up every womb of the house of Abimelech, because of Sarah Abraham’s wife.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now the Lord visited Sarah, as he had said, and did unto her according as he had promised.

text: For Sarah conceived, and bare Abraham a son in his old age, at the same season that God told him.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Abraham called his son’s name that was born unto him, which Sarah bare him, Isaac.

text: Then Abraham circumcised Isaac his son, when he was eight days old, as God had commanded him.

text: So Abraham was an hundred years old, when his son Isaac was born unto him.

text: Then Sarah said, God hath made me to rejoice: all that hear, will rejoice with me.

text: Again she said, Who would have said to Abraham, that Sarah should have given children suck? for I have borne him a son in his old age.

text: Then the child grew and was weaned: and Abraham made a great feast the same day that Isaac was weaned.

text: And Sarah saw the son of Hagar the Egyptian (which she had borne unto Abraham) mocking.

text: Wherefore she said unto Abraham, Cast out this bondwoman and her son: for the son of this bondwoman shall not be heir with my son Isaac.
speaker: Narrator

text: And this thing was very grievous in Abraham’s sight, because of his son.
speaker: Narrator

text: But God said unto Abraham, Let it not be grievous in thy sight for the child, and for thy bondwoman: in all that Sarah shall say unto thee, hear her voice: for in Isaac shall thy seed be called.

text: As for the son of the bondwoman, I will make him a nation also, because he is thy seed.
speaker: Narrator

text: So Abraham arose up early in the morning and took bread, and a bottle of water, and gave it unto Hagar putting it on her shoulder, and the child also, and sent her away: who departing, wandered in the wilderness of Beersheba.
speaker: Narrator

text: And when the water of the bottle was spent, she cast the child under a certain tree.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then she went and sat her over against him afar off about a bow shoot: for she said, I will not see the death of the child. And she sat down over against him, and lift up her voice, and wept.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then God heard the voice of the child, and the Angel of God called to Hagar from heaven, and said unto her, What aileth thee, Hagar? fear not, for God hath heard the voice of the child where he is.
speaker: Narrator

text: Arise, take up the child, and hold him in thine hand: for I will make him a great people.
speaker: Narrator

text: And God opened her eyes, and she saw a well of water: so she went and filled the bottle with water, and gave the boy drink.
