text: So God was with the child, and he grew and dwelt in the wilderness, and was an archer.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he dwelt in the wilderness of Paran, and his mother took him a wife out of the land of Egypt.
speaker: Narrator

text: And at the same time Abimelech and Phichol his chief captain spake unto Abraham, saying, God is with thee in all that thou doest.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now therefore swear unto me here by God, that thou wilt not hurt me, nor my children, nor my children’s children: thou shalt deal with me, and with the country, where thou hast been a stranger, according unto the kindness that I have showed thee.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Abraham said, I will swear.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Abraham rebuked Abimelech for a well of water, which Abimelech’s servants had violently taken away.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Abimelech said, I know not who hath done this thing: also thou toldest me not, neither heard I of it but this day.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Abraham took sheep and beeves, and gave them unto Abimelech: and they two made a covenant.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Abraham set seven lambs of the flock by themselves.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Abimelech said unto Abraham, What mean these seven lambs, which thou hast set by themselves?
speaker: Narrator

text: And he answered, Because thou shalt receive of mine hand these seven lambs, that it may be a witness unto me, that I have dug this well.
speaker: Narrator

text: Wherefore the place is called Beersheba, because there they both swear.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thus made they a covenant at Beersheba: afterward Abimelech and Phichol the chief captain rose up, and turned again unto the land of the Philistines.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Abraham planted a grove in Beersheba, and called there on the Name of the Lord, the everlasting God.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Abraham was a stranger in the Philistine’s land a long season.
speaker: Narrator

text: And after these things God did prove Abraham, and said unto him, Abraham. Who answered, Here am I.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he said, Take now thine only son Isaac whom thou lovest, and get thee unto the land of Moriah, and offer him there for a burnt offering upon one of the mountains, which I will show thee.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Abraham rose up early in the morning, and saddled his ass, and took two of his servants with him, and Isaac his son, and clove wood for the burnt offering, and rose up and went to the place, which God had told him.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then the third day Abraham lifted up his eyes, and saw the place afar off,
speaker: Narrator

text: And said unto his servants, Abide you here with the ass: for I and the child will go yonder and worship, and come again unto you.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Abraham took the wood of the burnt offering, and laid it upon Isaac his son, and he took the fire in his hand, and the knife: and they went both together.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then spake Isaac unto Abraham his father, and said, My father. And he answered, Here am I, my son. And he said, Behold the fire and the wood, but where is the lamb for the burnt offering?
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Abraham answered, My son, God will provide him a lamb for a burnt offering: so they went both together.
speaker: Narrator

text: And when they came to the place which God had showed him, Abraham built an altar there, and couched the wood, and bound Isaac his son, and laid him on the altar upon the wood.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Abraham stretching forth his hand, took the knife to kill his son.
speaker: Narrator

text: But the Angel of the Lord called unto him from heaven, saying, Abraham, Abraham. And he answered, Here am I.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then he said, Lay not thine hand upon the child, neither do anything unto him: for now I know that thou fearest God, seeing for my sake thou hast not spared thine only son.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Abraham lifting up his eyes, looked and behold, there was a ram behind him caught by the horns in a bush: then Abraham went and took the ram, and offered him up for a burnt offering in the stead of his son.

text: And Abraham called the name of that place Jehovah Jireh: as it is said this day, In the mount will the Lord be seen.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the Angel of the Lord cried unto Abraham from heaven the second time,
speaker: Narrator

text: And said, By myself have I sworn (saith the Lord) because thou hast done this thing, and hast not spared thine only son,

text: Therefore will I surely bless thee, and will greatly multiply thy seed, as the stars of the heaven, and as the sand which is upon the sea shore, and thy seed shall possess the gate of his enemies.
speaker: Narrator

text: And in thy seed shall all the nations of the earth be blessed, because thou hast obeyed my voice.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then turned Abraham again unto his servants, and they rose up, and went together to Beersheba: and Abraham dwelt at Beersheba.
speaker: Narrator

text: And after these things one told Abraham, saying, Behold Milcah, she hath also born children unto thy brother Nahor:

text: To wit, Huz his eldest son, and Buz his brother, and Kemuel the father of Aram,
speaker: Narrator

text: And Chesed, and Hazo, and Pildash, and Jidlaph, and Bethuel.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Bethuel begat Rebekah: these eight did Milcah bear to Nahor, Abraham’s brother.
speaker: Narrator

text: And his concubine called Reumah, she bare also Tebah, and Gaham, and Thahash and Maachah.
speaker: Narrator

text: When Sarah was an hundred twenty and seven years old (so long lived she.)
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Sarah died in Kirjath Arba: the same is Hebron in the land of Canaan. And Abraham came to mourn for Sarah and to weep for her.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Abraham rose up from the sight of his corpse, and talked with the Hittites, saying,
speaker: Narrator

text: I am a stranger, and a foreigner among you: give me a possession of burial with you, that I may bury my dead out of my sight.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then the Hittites answered Abraham, saying unto him,
speaker: Narrator

text: Hear us, my lord: thou art a prince of God among us: in the chiefest of our sepulchers bury the dead: none of us shall forbid thee his sepulcher, but thou mayest bury thy dead therein.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Abraham stood up, and bowed himself before the people of the land of the Hittites.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he communed with them, saying, If it be your mind, that I shall bury my dead out of my sight, hear me, and entreat for me to Ephron the son of Zohar,
speaker: Narrator

text: That he would give me the cave of Machpelah, which he hath in the end of his field: that he would give it me for as much money as it is worth, for a possession to bury in among you.
speaker: Narrator

text: (For Ephron dwelt among the Hittites) Then Ephron the Hittite answered Abraham in the audience of all the Hittites that went in at the gates of his city, saying,
speaker: Narrator

text: No, my Lord, hear me: the field give I thee and the cave that therein is, I give it thee: even in the presence of the sons of my people give I it thee to bury thy dead.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Abraham bowed himself before the people of the land,
speaker: Narrator

text: And spake unto Ephron in the audience of the people of the country, saying, Seeing thou wilt give it, I pray thee, hear me, I will give the price of the field: receive it of me, and I will bury my dead there.
speaker: Narrator

text: Ephron then answered Abraham, saying unto him,
speaker: Narrator

text: My lord, hearken unto me: the land is worth four hundred shekels of silver: what is that between me and thee? bury therefore thy dead.
speaker: Narrator

text: So Abraham hearkened unto Ephron, and Abraham weighed to Ephron the silver, which he had named, in the audience of the Hittites, even four hundred silver shekels of current money among merchants.
speaker: Narrator

text: So the field of Ephron which was in Machpelah, and over against Mamre, even the field and the cave that was therein, and all the trees that were in the field, which were in all the borders round about, was made sure
speaker: Narrator

text: Unto Abraham for a possession, in the sight of the Hittites, even of all that went in at the gates of his city.
speaker: Narrator

text: And after this, Abraham buried Sarah his wife in the cave of the field of Machpelah over against Mamre: the same is Hebron in the land of Canaan.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thus the field, and the cave that is therein, was made sure unto Abraham for a possession of burial by the Hittites.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now Abraham was old, and stricken in years, and the Lord had blessed Abraham in all things.
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore Abraham said unto his eldest servant of his house, which had the rule over all that he had, Put now thine hand under my thigh,
speaker: Narrator

text: And I will make thee swear by the Lord God of the heaven, and God of the earth, that thou shalt not take a wife unto my son of the daughters of the Canaanites among whom I dwell:
speaker: Narrator

text: But thou shalt go unto my country, and to my kindred, and take a wife unto my son Isaac.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the servant said to him, What if the woman will not come with me to this land? shall I bring thy son again unto the land from whence thou camest?
speaker: Narrator

text: To whom Abraham answered, Beware that thou bring not my son thither again.
speaker: Narrator

text: The Lord God of heaven, who took me from my father’s house, and from the land where I was born, and that spake unto me, and that swear unto me, saying, Unto thy seed will I give this land, he shall send his Angel before thee, and thou shalt take a wife unto my son from thence.
speaker: Narrator

text: Nevertheless if the woman will not follow thee, then shalt thou be discharged of this mine oath: only bring not my son thither again.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then the servant put his hand under the thigh of Abraham his master, and sware to him for this matter.
speaker: Narrator

text: So the servant took ten camels of the camels of his master, and departed: (for he had all his master’s goods in his hand:) and so he arose, and went to Aram Naharaim, unto the city of Nahor.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he made his camels to lie down without the city by a well of water, at eventide about the time that the women come out to draw water.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he said, O Lord God of my master Abraham, I beseech thee, send me good speed this day, and show mercy unto my master Abraham.
speaker: Narrator

text: Lo, I stand by the well of water while the men’s daughters of this city come out to draw water.
speaker: Narrator

text: Grant therefore that the maid, to whom I say: Bow down thy pitcher, I pray thee, that I may drink: if she say, Drink, and I will give thy camels drink also: may be she that thou hast ordained for thy servant Isaac: and thereby shall I know that thou hast showed mercy on my master.
speaker: Narrator

text: And now yet he had left speaking, behold, Rebekah came out, the daughter of Bethuel, son of Milcah the wife of Nahor Abraham’s brother, and her Pitcher upon her shoulder.
speaker: Narrator

text: (And the maid was very fair to look upon, a virgin and unknown of man) and she went down to the well, and filled her pitcher and came up.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then the servant ran to meet her, and said, Let me drink, I pray thee, a little water of thy pitcher.
speaker: Narrator

text: And she said, Drink sir: and she hasted, and let down her pitcher upon her hand and gave him drink.
speaker: Narrator

text: And when she had given him drink, she said, I will draw water for thy camels also until they have drunken enough.
speaker: Narrator

text: And she poured out her pitcher into the trough speedily, and ran again unto the well to draw water, and she drew for all his camels.
speaker: Narrator

text: So the man wondered at her, and held his peace, to know whether the Lord had made his journey prosperous or not.
speaker: Narrator

text: And when the camels had left drinking, the man took a golden abillement of half a shekel weight, and two bracelets for her hands, of ten shekels weight of gold:
speaker: Narrator

text: And he said, Whose daughter art thou? tell me, I pray thee, Is there room in thy father’s house for us to lodge in?
speaker: Narrator

text: Then she said to him, I am the daughter of Bethuel the son of Milcah whom she bare unto Nahor.
speaker: Narrator

text: Moreover she said unto him, We have litter also and provender enough, and room to lodge in.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the man bowed himself and worshipped the Lord,
speaker: Narrator

text: And said, Blessed be the Lord God of my master Abraham, which hath not withdrawn his mercy and his truth from my master: for when I was in the way, the Lord brought me to my master’s brethren’s house.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the maid ran and told them of her mother’s house according to these words.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now Rebekah had a brother called Laban, and Laban ran unto the man to the well.
speaker: Narrator

text: For when he had seen the earrings and bracelets in his sister’s hands, and when he heard the words of Rebekah his sister, saying, Thus said the man unto me, then he went to the man, and lo, he stood by the camels at the well.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he said, Come in thou blessed of the Lord: wherefore standest thou without, seeing I have prepared the house, and room for the camels?
speaker: Narrator

text: Then the man came into the house, and he unsaddled the camels, and brought litter and provender for the camels, and water to wash his feet, and the men’s feet that were with him.
speaker: Narrator

text: Afterward the meat was set before him: but he said, I will not eat, until I have said my message. And he said: Speak on.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then he said, I am Abraham’s servant,
speaker: Narrator

text: And the Lord hath blessed my master wonderfully, that he is become great: for he hath given him sheep, and beeves, and silver, and gold, and men servants, and maid servants, and camels, and asses.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Sarah my master’s wife hath borne a son to my master, when she was old, and unto him hath he given all that he hath.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now my master made me swear, saying, Thou shalt not take a wife to my son of the daughters of the Canaanites, in whose land I dwell:
speaker: Narrator

text: But thou shalt go unto my father’s house and to my kindred, and take a wife unto my son.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then I said unto my master, What if the woman will not follow me?
speaker: Narrator

text: Who answered me, The Lord, before who I walk, will send his Angel with thee, and prosper thy journey, and thou shalt take a wife for my son of my kindred and my father’s house.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then shalt thou be discharged of mine oath, when thou comest to my kindred: and if they give thee not one, thou shalt be free from mine oath.
speaker: Narrator

text: So I came this day to the well, and said, O Lord, the God of my master Abraham, if thou now prosper my journey which I go,
speaker: Narrator

text: Behold, I stand by the well of water when a virgin cometh forth to draw water, and I say to her, Give me, I pray thee, a little water of thy pitcher to drink,
speaker: Narrator

text: And she said to me, Drink thou, and I will also draw for thy camels, let her be the wife, which the Lord hath prepared for thy master’s son.
speaker: Narrator

text: And before I had made an end of speaking in mine heart, behold, Rebekah came forth and her pitcher on her shoulder, and she went down to the well, and drew water. Then I said unto her, Give me drink, I pray thee.
speaker: Narrator

text: And she made haste, and took down her pitcher from her shoulder, and said, Drink, and I will give thy camels drink also. So I drank, and she gave the camels drink also.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then I asked her, and said, Whose daughter art thou? And she answered, The daughter of Bethuel Nahor’s son, whom Milcah bare unto him. Then I put the abillement upon her face, and the bracelets upon her hands:
speaker: Narrator

text: And I bowed down and worshipped the Lord, and blessed the Lord God of my master Abraham, which had brought me the right way to take my master’s brother’s daughter unto his son.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now therefore, if ye will deal mercifully and truly with my master, tell me: and if not, tell me, that I may turn me to the right hand or to the left.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then answered Laban and Bethuel, and said, This thing is proceeded of the Lord: we cannot therefore say unto thee, neither evil nor good.
speaker: Narrator

text: Behold, Rebekah is before thee, take her and go, that she may be thy master’s son’s wife, even as the Lord hath said.
speaker: Narrator

text: And when Abraham’s servant heard their words, he bowed himself toward the earth unto the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then the servant took forth jewels of silver, and jewels of gold, and raiment, and gave to Rebekah: also unto her brother and to her mother he gave gifts.
speaker: Narrator

text: Afterward they did eat and drink, both he, and the men that were with him, and tarried all night, and when they rose up in the morning, he said, Let me depart unto my master.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then her brother and her mother answered, Let the maid abide with us, at the least ten days: then shall she go.
speaker: Narrator

text: But he said unto them, Hinder you me not, seeing the Lord hath prospered my journey: send me away, that I may go to my master.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then they said, We will call the maid, and ask her consent.
speaker: Narrator

text: And they called Rebekah, and said unto her: Wilt thou go with this man? And she answered, I will go.
speaker: Narrator

text: So they let Rebekah their sister go, and her nurse, with Abraham’s servant and his men.
speaker: Narrator

text: And they blessed Rebekah, and said unto her, Thou art our sister, grow into thousand thousand’s, and thy seed possess the gate of his enemies.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Rebekah arose, and her maids, and rode upon the camels, and followed the man, and the servant took Rebekah and departed.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now Isaac came from the way of Beer Lahai Roi, (for he dwelt in the South country.)
speaker: Narrator

text: And Isaac went out to pray in the field toward the evening: who lift up his eyes and looked, and behold, the camels came.
speaker: Narrator

text: Also Rebekah lift up her eyes, and when she saw Isaac, she lighted down from the camel.
speaker: Narrator

text: (For she had said to the servant, Who is yonder man, that cometh in the field to meet us? and the servant had said, It is my master) So she took a veil, and covered her.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the servant told Isaac all things, that he had done.
speaker: Narrator

text: Afterward Isaac brought her into the tent, of Sarah his mother, and he took Rebekah, and she was his wife, and he loved her: So Isaac was comforted after his mother’s death.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now Abraham had taken him another wife called Keturah,
speaker: Narrator

text: Which bare him Zimran, and Jokshan, and Medan, and Midian, and Ishbak, and Shuah.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Jokshan, begat Sheba, and Dedan: And the sons of Dedan were Asshurim, and Letushim, and Leummim.
speaker: Narrator

text: Also the sons of Midian were Ephah, and Epher, and Hanoch, and Abidah, and Eldaah, all these were the sons of Keturah.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Abraham gave all his goods to Isaac.
speaker: Narrator

text: But unto the sons of the concubines, which Abraham had, Abraham gave gifts, and sent them away from Isaac his son (while he yet lived) Eastward to the East country.
speaker: Narrator

text: And this is the age of Abraham’s life, which he lived, an hundred seventy and five years.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Abraham yielded the spirit, and died in a good age, an old man, and of great years, and was gathered to his people.
speaker: Narrator

text: And his sons Isaac and Ishmael buried him in the cave of Machpelah, in the field of Ephron son of Zohar the Hittite, before Mamre,
speaker: Narrator

text: Which field Abraham bought of the Hittites, where Abraham was buried with Sarah his wife.
speaker: Narrator

text: And after the death of Abraham God blessed Isaac his son, and Isaac dwelt by Beer Lahai Roi.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now these are the generations of Ishmael Abraham’s son, whom Hagar the Egyptian Sarah’s handmaid bare unto Abraham.
speaker: Narrator

text: And these are the names of the sons of Ishmael, name by name, according to their kindreds: the eldest son of Ishmael was Nebajoth then Kedar, and Adbeel, and Mibsam,
speaker: Narrator

text: And Mishma, and Dumah, and Massa,
speaker: Narrator

text: Hadar, and Tema, Jetur, Naphish, and Kedemah.
speaker: Narrator

text: These are the sons of Ishmael, and these are their names, by their towns and by their castles: to wit, twelve princes of their nations.
speaker: Narrator

text: (And these are the years of the life of Ishmael, an hundred thirty and seven years, and he yielded up the spirit, and died, and was gathered unto his people.)
speaker: Narrator

text: And they dwelt from Havilah unto Shur, that is towards Egypt, as thou goest to Asshur. Ishmael dwelt in the presence of all his brethren.
speaker: Narrator

text: Likewise these are the generations of Isaac Abraham’s son. Abraham begat Isaac.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Isaac was forty years old, when he took Rebekah to wife, the daughter of Bethuel the Aramite of Padan Aram, and sister to Laban the Aramite.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Isaac prayed unto the Lord for his wife, because she was barren: and the Lord was entreated of him, and Rebekah his wife conceived.
speaker: Narrator

text: But the children strove together within her: therefore she said, Seeing it is so, why am I thus? wherefore she went to ask the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the Lord said to her, Two nations are in thy womb, and two manner of people shall be divided out of thy bowels, and the one people shall be mightier than the other, and the elder shall serve the younger.
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore when her time of deliverance was fulfilled, behold, twins were in her womb.
speaker: Narrator

text: So he that came out first was red, and he was all over as rough as a garment, and they called his name Esau.
speaker: Narrator

text: And afterward came his brother out, and his hand held Esau by the heel, therefore his name was called Jacob. Now Isaac was threescore years old when Rebekah bare them.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the boys grew, and Esau was a cunning hunter, and lived in the fields: but Jacob was a plain man, and dwelt in tents.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Isaac loved Esau, for venison was his meat, but Rebekah loved Jacob.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now Jacob sod pottage, and Esau came from the field and was weary.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Esau said to Jacob, Let me eat, I pray thee, of that pottage so red, for I am weary. Therefore was his name called Edom.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Jacob said, Sell me even now thy birthright.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Esau said, Lo, I am almost dead, what is then this birthright to me?
speaker: Narrator

text: Jacob then said, Swear to me even now. And he swear to him, and sold his birthright unto Jacob.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Jacob gave Esau bread and pottage of lentils: and he did eat and drink, and rose up, and went his way: So Esau contemned his birthright.
speaker: Narrator

text: And there was a famine in the land besides the first famine that was in the days of Abraham. Wherefore Isaac went to Abimelech King of the Philistines unto Gerar.
speaker: Narrator

text: For the Lord appeared unto him, and said, Go not down into Egypt, but abide in the land which I shall show thee.
speaker: Narrator

text: Dwell in this land, and I will be with thee, and will bless thee: for to thee, and to thy seed I will give all these countries, and I will perform the oath which I swear unto Abraham thy father.
speaker: Narrator

text: Also I will cause thy seed to multiply as the stars of heaven, and will give unto thy seed all these countries: and in thy seed shall all the nations of the earth be blessed,
speaker: Narrator

text: Because that Abraham obeyed my voice and kept mine ordinance, my commandments, my statutes, and my laws.
speaker: Narrator

text: So Isaac dwelt in Gerar.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the men of the place asked him of his wife, and he said, She is my sister: for he feared to say, she is my wife, lest, said he, the men of the place should kill me, because of Rebekah, for she was beautiful to the eye.
speaker: Narrator

text: So after he had been there a long time, Abimelech King of the Philistines looked out at a window, and lo, he saw Isaac sporting with Rebekah his wife.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Abimelech called Isaac, and said, Lo, she is of a surety thy wife, and why saidest thou, She is my sister? To whom Isaac answered, Because I thought this, It may be that I shall die for her.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Abimelech said, Why hast thou done this unto us? one of the people had almost lain by thy wife, so shouldest thou have brought sin upon us.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Abimelech charged all his people, saying, He that toucheth this man, or his wife, shall die the death.
speaker: Narrator

text: Afterward Isaac sowed in that land, and found in the same year an hundredfold by estimation: and so the Lord blessed him.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the man waxed mightily, and still increased, till he was exceeding great.
speaker: Narrator

text: For he had flocks of sheep, and herds of cattle, and a mighty household: therefore the Philistines had envy at him,
speaker: Narrator

text: Insomuch that the Philistines stopped, and filled up with earth all the wells, which his father’s servants dug in his father Abraham’s time.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Abimelech said unto Isaac, Get thee from us, for thou art mightier than we a great deal.
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore Isaac departed thence and pitched his tent in the valley of Gerar, and dwelt there.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Isaac returning, dug the wells of water, which they had dug in the days of Abraham his father, for the Philistines had stopped them after the death of Abraham, and he gave them the same names, that his father gave them.
speaker: Narrator

text: Isaac’s servants then dug in the valley and found there a well of living water.
speaker: Narrator

text: But the herdsmen of Gerar did strive with Isaac’s herdsmen, saying, The water is ours, therefore called he the name of the well Esek, because they were at strife with him.
speaker: Narrator

text: Afterward they dug another well, and strove for that also, and he called the name of it Sitnah.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then he removed thence, and dug another well, for which they strove not: therefore called he the name of it Rehoboth, and said, Because the Lord hath now made us room, we shall increase upon the earth.
speaker: Narrator

text: So he went up thence to Beersheba.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the Lord appeared unto him the same night, and said, I am the God of Abraham thy father: fear not, I am with thee, and will bless thee, and multiply thy seed for my servant Abraham’s sake.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then he built an altar there, and called upon the Name of the Lord, and there spread his tent: where also Isaac’s servants dug a well.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then came Abimelech to him from Gerar, and Ahuzzath one of his friends, and Phichol the captain of his army.
speaker: Narrator

text: To whom Isaac said, Wherefore come ye to me, seeing ye hate me and have put me away from you?
speaker: Narrator

text: Who answered, We saw certainly that the Lord was with thee, and we thought thus, Let there be now an oath between us, even between us and thee, and let us make a covenant with thee.
speaker: Narrator

text: If thou shalt do us no hurt, as we have not touched thee, and as we have done unto thee nothing but good, and sent thee away in peace: thou now, the blessed of the Lord, do this.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then he made them a feast, and they did eat and drink.
speaker: Narrator

text: And they rose up betimes in the morning, and swear one to another: then Isaac let them go, and they departed from him in peace.
speaker: Narrator

text: And that same day Isaac’s servants came and told him of a well, which they had dug, and said unto him, We have found water.
speaker: Narrator

text: So he called it Shebah: therefore the name of the city is called Beersheba unto this day.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now when Esau was forty years old, he took to wife Judith, the daughter of Beeri an Hittite, and Basemath the daughter of Elon an Hittite also.
speaker: Narrator

text: And they were a grief of mind to Isaac and to Rebekah.
speaker: Narrator

text: And when Isaac was old, and his eyes were dim (so that he could not see) he called Esau his eldest son, and said unto him, My son. And he answered him, I am here.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then he said, Behold, I am now old, and know not the day of my death.
speaker: Narrator

text: Wherefore now, I pray thee take thine instruments, thy quiver and thy bow, and get thee to the field, that thou mayest take me some venison.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then make me savory meat, such as I love, and bring it me that I may eat, and that my soul may bless thee, before I die.
speaker: Narrator

text: (Now Rebekah heard, when Isaac spake to Esau his son) and Esau went into the field to hunt for venison, and to bring it.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Rebekah spake unto Jacob her son, saying, Behold, I have heard thy father talking with Esau thy brother, saying,
speaker: Narrator

text: Bring me venison, and make me savory meat, that I may eat and bless thee before the Lord, afore my death.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now therefore, my son, hear my voice in that which I command thee.
speaker: Narrator

text: Get thee now to the flock, and bring me thence two good kids of the goats, that I may make pleasant meat of them for thy father, such as he loveth.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then thou shalt bring it to thy father, and he shall eat, to the intent that he may bless thee before his death.
speaker: Narrator

text: But Jacob said to Rebekah his mother, Behold, Esau my brother is rough, and I am smooth.
speaker: Narrator

text: My father may possibly feel me, and I shall seem to him as a mocker: so shall I bring a curse upon me, and not a blessing.
speaker: Narrator

text: But his mother said unto him, Upon me be thy curse, my son: only hear my voice, and go and bring me them.
speaker: Narrator

text: So he went and set them, and brought them to his mother: and his mother made pleasant meat, such as his father loved.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Rebekah took fair clothes of her elder son Esau, which were in her house, and clothed Jacob her younger son:
speaker: Narrator

text: And she covered his hands and the smooth of his neck with the skins of the kids of the goats.
speaker: Narrator

text: Afterward she put the pleasant meat and bread, which she had prepared, in the hand of her son Jacob.
speaker: Narrator

text: And when he came to his father, he said, My father. Who answered, I am here: who art thou, my son?
speaker: Narrator

text: And Jacob said to his father, I am Esau thy firstborn, I have done as thou badest me, arise, I pray thee: sit up and eat of my venison, that thy soul may bless me.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Isaac said unto his son, How hast thou found it so quickly my son? Who said, Because the Lord thy God brought it to mine hand.
speaker: Narrator

text: Again said Isaac unto Jacob, Come near now, that I may feel thee, my son, whether thou be that my son Esau, or not.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Jacob came near to Isaac his father, and he felt him and said, The voice is Jacob’s voice, but the hands are the hands of Esau.
speaker: Narrator

text: (For he knew him not, because his hands were rough as his brother Esau’s hands: wherefore he blessed him.)
speaker: Narrator

text: Again he said, Art thou that my son Esau? Who answered, Yea.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then said he, Bring it me hither, and I will eat of my son’s venison, that my soul may bless thee. And he brought it to him, and he ate: also he brought him wine, and he drank.
speaker: Narrator

text: Afterward his father Isaac said unto him, Come near now, and kiss me, my son.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he came near and kissed him. Then he smelled the savor of his garments, and blessed him, and said, Behold, the smell of my son is as the smell of a field, which the Lord hath blessed.
speaker: Narrator

text: God give thee therefore of the dew of heaven, and the fatness of the earth, and plenty of wheat and wine.
speaker: Narrator

text: Let people be thy servants, and nations bow down unto thee: be Lord over thy brethren, and let thy mother’s children honor thee, cursed be he that curseth thee, and blessed be he that blesseth thee.
speaker: Narrator

text: And when Isaac had made an end of blessing Jacob, and Jacob was scarce gone out from the presence of Isaac his father, then came Esau his brother from his hunting,
speaker: Narrator

text: And he also prepared savory meat, and brought it to his father, and said unto his father, Let my father arise, and eat of his son’s venison, that thy soul may bless me.
speaker: Narrator

text: But his father Isaac said unto him, Who art thou? And he answered, I am thy son, even thy firstborn Esau.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Isaac was stricken with a marvelous great fear, and said, Who and where is he that hunted venison, and brought it me, and I have eaten of all before thou camest? and I have blessed him, therefore he shall be blessed.
speaker: Narrator

text: When Esau heard the words of his father, he cried out with a great cry and bitter, out of measure, and said unto his father, Bless me, even me also, my father.
speaker: Narrator

text: Who answered, Thy brother came with subtlety, and hath taken away thy blessing.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then he said, Was he not justly called Jacob? for he hath deceived me these two times: he took my birthright, and lo, now hath he taken my blessing. Also he said, Hast thou not reserved a blessing for me?
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Isaac answered, and said unto Esau, Behold, I have made him thy lord, and all his brethren have I made his servants: and with wheat and wine have I furnished him, and unto thee now what shall I do, my son?
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Esau said unto his father, Hast thou but one blessing, my father? bless me, even me, also my father: and Esau lifted up his voice, and wept.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Isaac his father answered, and said unto him, Behold, the fatness of the earth shall be thy dwelling place, and thou shalt have of the dew of heaven from above.
speaker: Narrator

text: And by thy word shalt thou live, and shalt be thy brother’s servant. But it shall come to pass, when thou shalt get the mastery, that thou shalt break his yoke from thy neck.
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore Esau hated Jacob, because of the blessing, wherewith his father blessed him. And Esau thought in his mind, The days of mourning for my father will come shortly, then I will slay my brother Jacob.
speaker: Narrator

text: And it was told to Rebekah of the words of Esau her elder son, and she sent and called Jacob her younger son, and said unto him, Behold, thy brother Esau is comforted against thee, meaning to kill thee:
speaker: Narrator

text: Now therefore my son, hear my voice: arise, and flee thou to Haran to my brother Laban,
speaker: Narrator

text: And tarry with him a while until thy brother’s fierceness be swaged,
speaker: Narrator

text: And till thy brother’s wrath turn away from thee, and he forget the things, which thou hast done to him: then will I send and take thee from thence: why should I be deprived of you both in one day?
speaker: Narrator

text: Also Rebekah said to Isaac, I am weary of my life, for the daughters of Heth. If Jacob take a wife of the daughters of Heth like these of the daughters of the land, what availeth it me to live?
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Isaac called Jacob and blessed him, and charged him, and said unto him, take not a wife of the daughters of Canaan.
speaker: Narrator

text: Arise, get thee to Padan Aram to the house of Bethuel thy mother’s father, and thence take thee a wife of the daughters of Laban thy mother’s brother.
speaker: Narrator

text: And God all sufficient bless thee, and make thee to increase, and multiply thee, that thou mayest be a multitude of people,
speaker: Narrator

text: And give thee the blessing of Abraham, even to thee and to thy seed with thee, that thou mayest inherit the land (wherein thou art a stranger,) which God gave unto Abraham.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thus Isaac sent forth Jacob, and he went to Padan Aram unto Laban son of Bethuel the Aramite, brother to Rebekah, Jacob’s and Esau’s mother.
speaker: Narrator

text: When Esau saw that Isaac had blessed Jacob, and sent him to Padan Aram, to fetch him a wife thence, and given him a charge when he blessed him, saying, Thou shalt not take a wife of the daughters of Canaan,
speaker: Narrator

text: And that Jacob had obeyed his father and his mother, and was gone to Padan Aram:
speaker: Narrator

text: Also Esau seeing that the daughters of Canaan displeased Isaac his father,
speaker: Narrator

text: Then went Esau to Ishmael, and took unto the wives which he had, Mahalath the daughter of Ishmael Abraham’s son, the sister of Nebajoth, to be his wife.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now Jacob departed from Beersheba, and went to Haran,
speaker: Narrator

text: And he came unto a certain place, and tarried there all night because the sun was down, and took of the stones of the place, and laid under his head and slept in the same place.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then he dreamed, and behold, there stood a ladder upon the earth, and the top of it reached up to heaven: and lo, the Angels of God went up and down by it.
speaker: Narrator

text: And behold, the Lord stood above it, and said, I am the Lord God of Abraham thy father, and the God of Isaac: the land, upon the which thou sleepest, will I give thee and thy seed.
speaker: Narrator

text: And thy seed shall be as the dust of the earth, and thou shalt spread abroad to the West, and to the East, and to the North, and to the South, and in thee and in thy seed shall all the families of the earth be blessed.
speaker: Narrator

text: And lo, I am with thee, and will keep thee whithersoever thou goest, and will bring thee again into this land: for I will not forsake thee until I have performed that, that I have promised thee.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Jacob awoke out of his sleep and said, Surely the Lord is in this place, and I was not aware.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he was afraid, and said, How fearful is this place! this is none other but the house of God, and this is the gate of heaven.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Jacob rose up early in the morning, and took the stone that he had laid under his head, and set it up as a pillar, and poured oil upon the top of it.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he called the name of that place Bethel: notwithstanding the name of that city was at the first called Luz.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Jacob vowed a vow, saying, If God will be with me, and will keep me in this journey which I go, and will give me bread to eat, and clothes to put on:
speaker: Narrator

text: So that I come again unto my father’s house in safety, then shall the Lord be my God.
speaker: Narrator

text: And this stone, which I have set up as a pillar, shall be God’s house: and of all that thou shalt give me, will I give the tenth unto thee.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Jacob lift up his feet and came into the East country.
speaker: Narrator

text: And as he looked about, behold, there was a well in the field, and lo, three flocks of sheep lay thereby (for at that well were the flocks watered) and there was a great stone upon the well’s mouth.
speaker: Narrator

text: And thither were all the flocks gathered, and they rolled the stone from the well’s mouth, and watered the sheep, and put the stone again upon the well’s mouth in his place.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Jacob said unto them, My brethren, whence be ye? And they answered, We are of Haran.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then he said unto them, Know ye Laban the son of Nahor? Who said, We know him.
speaker: Narrator

text: Again he said unto them, Is he in good health? And they answered, He is in good health, and behold, his daughter Rachel cometh with the sheep.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then he said, Lo, it is yet high day, neither is it time that the cattle should be gathered together: water ye the sheep and go feed them.
speaker: Narrator

text: But they said, We may not, until all the flocks be brought together, and till men roll the stone from the well’s mouth, that we may water the sheep.
speaker: Narrator

text: While he talked with them, Rachel also came with her father’s sheep, for she kept them.
speaker: Narrator

text: And as soon as Jacob saw Rachel the daughter of Laban his mother’s brother, and the sheep of Laban his mother’s brother, then came Jacob near, and rolled the stone from the well’s mouth, and watered the flock of Laban his mother’s brother.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Jacob kissed Rachel, and lifted up his voice and wept.
speaker: Narrator

text: (For Jacob told Rachel, that he was her father’s brother, and that he was Rebekah’s son) then she ran and told her father.
speaker: Narrator

text: And when Laban heard tell of Jacob his sister’s son, he ran to meet him, and embraced him and kissed him, and brought him to his house: and he told Laban all these things.
speaker: Narrator

text: To whom Laban said, Well, thou art my bone and my flesh, and he abode with him the space of a month.
speaker: Narrator

text: For Laban said unto Jacob, Though thou be my brother, shouldest thou therefore serve me for nought? tell me, what shall be thy wages?
speaker: Narrator

text: Now Laban had two daughters, the elder called Leah, and the younger called Rachel.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Leah was tender eyed, but Rachel was beautiful and fair.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Jacob loved Rachel, and said, I will serve thee seven years for Rachel thy younger daughter.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Laban answered, It is better that I give her thee, than that I should give her to another man: abide with me.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Jacob served seven years for Rachel, and they seemed unto him but a few days, because he loved her.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Jacob said to Laban, Give me my wife, that I may go in to her: for my term is ended.
speaker: Narrator

text: Wherefore Laban gathered together all the men of the place, and made a feast.
speaker: Narrator

text: But when the evening was come, he took Leah his daughter, and brought her to him, and he went in unto her.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Laban gave his maid Zilpah to his daughter Leah, to be her servant.
speaker: Narrator

text: But when the morning was come, behold, it was Leah. Then said he to Laban, Wherefore hast thou done thus to me? did not I serve thee for Rachel? wherefore then hast thou beguiled me?
speaker: Narrator

text: And Laban answered, It is not the manner of this place, to give the younger before the elder.
speaker: Narrator

text: Fulfill seven years for her, and we will also give thee this for the service, which thou shalt serve me yet seven years more.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Jacob did so, and fulfilled her seven years, so he gave him Rachel his daughter to be his wife.
speaker: Narrator

text: Laban also gave to Rachel his daughter, Bilhah his maid to be her servant.
speaker: Narrator

text: So entered he in to Rachel also, and loved also Rachel more than Leah, and served him yet seven years more.
speaker: Narrator

text: When the Lord saw that Leah was despised, he made her fruitful: but Rachel was barren.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Leah conceived and bare a son, and she called his name Reuben: for she said, Because the Lord hath looked upon my tribulation, now therefore mine husband will love me.
speaker: Narrator

text: And she conceived again and bare a son, and said, Because the Lord heard that I was hated, he hath therefore given me this son also, and she called his name Simeon.
speaker: Narrator

text: And she conceived again and bare a son, and said, Now at this time will my husband keep me company, because I have borne him three sons: therefore was his name called Levi.
speaker: Narrator

text: Moreover she conceived again and bare a son, saying, Now will I praise the Lord: therefore she called his name Judah, and left bearing.
speaker: Narrator

text: And when Rachel saw that she bare Jacob no children, Rachel envied her sister, and said unto Jacob, Give me children, or else I die.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Jacob’s anger was kindled against Rachel, and he said, Am I in God’s stead, which hath withholden from thee the fruit of the womb?
speaker: Narrator

text: And she said, Behold my maid Bilhah, go in to her, and she shall bear upon my knees, and I shall have children also by her.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then she gave him Bilhah her maid to wife, and Jacob went in to her.
speaker: Narrator

text: So Bilhah conceived and bare Jacob a son.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then said Rachel, God hath given sentence on my side, and hath also heard my voice, and hath given me a son: therefore called she his name, Dan.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Bilhah Rachel’s maid conceived again, and bare Jacob the second son.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Rachel said, With excellent wrestlings have I wrestled with my sister, and have gotten the upper hand: and she called his name, Naphtali.
speaker: Narrator

text: And when Leah saw that she had left bearing, she took Zilpah her maid, and gave her Jacob to wife.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Zilpah Leah’s maid bare Jacob a son.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then said Leah, A company cometh: and she called his name, Gad.
speaker: Narrator

text: Again Zilpah Leah’s maid bare Jacob another son.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then said Leah, Ah, blessed am I, for the daughters will bless me, and she called his name Asher.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now Reuben went in the days of the wheat harvest, and found mandrakes in the field, and brought them unto his mother Leah. Then said Rachel to Leah, Give me, I pray thee, of thy son’s mandrakes.
speaker: Narrator

text: But she answered her, Is it a small matter for thee to take mine husband, except thou take my son’s mandrakes also? Then said Rachel, Therefore he shall sleep with thee this night for thy son’s mandrakes.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Jacob came from the field in the evening, and Leah went out to meet him, and said, Come in to me, for I have bought and paid for thee with my son’s mandrakes: and he slept with her that night.
speaker: Narrator

text: And God heard Leah and she conceived, and bare unto Jacob the fifth son.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then said Leah, God hath given me my reward, because I gave my maid to my husband, and she called his name Issachar.
speaker: Narrator

text: After, Leah conceived again, and bare Jacob the sixth son.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Leah said, God hath endowed me with a good dowry: now will mine husband dwell with me, because I have borne him six sons: and she called his name Zebulun.
speaker: Narrator

text: After that, she bare a daughter, and she called her name Dinah.
speaker: Narrator

text: And God remembered Rachel, and God heard her, and opened her womb.
speaker: Narrator

text: So she conceived and bare a son, and said, God hath taken away my rebuke.
speaker: Narrator

text: And she called his name Joseph, saying, The Lord will give me yet another son.
speaker: Narrator

text: And as soon as Rachel had borne Joseph, Jacob said to Laban, Send me away that I may go unto my place and to my country.
speaker: Narrator

text: Give me my wives and my children, for whom I have served thee, and let me go: for thou knowest what service I have done thee.
speaker: Narrator

text: To whom Laban answered, If I have now found favor in thy sight, tarry: I have perceived that the Lord hath blessed me for thy sake.
speaker: Narrator

text: Also he said, Appoint unto me thy wages, and I will give it thee.
speaker: Narrator

text: But he said unto him, Thou knowest, what service I have done thee, and in what taking thy cattle hath been under me.
speaker: Narrator

text: For the little, that thou haddest before I came, is increased into a multitude: and the Lord hath blessed thee by my coming: but now when shall I travail for mine own house also?
speaker: Narrator

text: Then he said, What shall I give thee? And Jacob answered, Thou shalt give me nothing at all: if thou wilt do this thing for me, I will return, feed, and keep thy sheep.
speaker: Narrator

text: I will pass through all thy flocks this day, and separate from them all the sheep with little spots and great spots, and all black lambs among the sheep, and the great spotted, and little spotted among the goats: and it shall be my wages.
speaker: Narrator

text: So shall my righteousness answer for me hereafter, when it shall come for my reward before thy face, and everyone that hath not little or great spots among the goats, and black among the sheep, the same shall be theft with me.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Laban said, Go to, would God it might be according to thy saying.
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore he took out the same day the he goats that were parti-colored and with great spots, and all the she goats with little and great spots, and all that had white in them, and all the black among the sheep, and put them in the keeping of his sons.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he set three days journey between himself and Jacob. And Jacob kept the rest of Laban’s sheep.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Jacob took rods of green poplar, and of hazel, and of the chestnut tree, and pilled white strakes in them, and made the white appear in the rods.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then he put the rods, which he had pilled, in the gutters and watering troughs, when the sheep came to drink, before the sheep: (for they were in heat, when they came to drink.)
speaker: Narrator

text: And the sheep were in heat before the rods, and afterward brought forth young of parti-color, and with small and great spots.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Jacob parted these lambs, and turned the faces of the flock towards those lambs parti-colored, and all manner of black, among the sheep of Laban: so he put his own flock by themselves, and put them not with Laban’s flock.
speaker: Narrator

text: And in every ramming time of the stronger sheep, Jacob laid the rods before the eyes of the sheep in the gutters, that they might conceive before the rods.
speaker: Narrator

text: But when the sheep were feeble, he put them not in: and so the feebler were Laban’s, and the stronger Jacob’s.
speaker: Narrator

text: So the man increased exceedingly, and had many flocks, and maid servants, and men servants, and camels, and asses.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now he heard the words of Laban’s sons, saying, Jacob hath taken away all that was our father’s, and of our father’s goods hath he gotten all this honor.
speaker: Narrator

text: Also Jacob beheld the countenance of Laban, that it was not towards him as in times past:
speaker: Narrator

text: And the Lord had said unto Jacob, Turn again into the land of thy fathers, and to thy kindred, and I will be with thee.
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore Jacob sent and called Rachel and Leah to the field unto his flock.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then said he unto them, I see your father’s countenance, that it is not towards me as it was wont, and the God of my father hath been with me.
speaker: Narrator

text: And ye know that I have served your father with all my might,
speaker: Narrator

text: But your father hath deceived me, and changed my wages ten times: but God suffered him not to hurt me.
speaker: Narrator

text: If he thus said, The spotted shall be thy wages, then all the sheep bare spotted: and if he said thus, the parti-colored shall be thy reward, then bare all the sheep parti-colored.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thus hath God taken away your father’s substance, and given it me.
speaker: Narrator

text: For in ramming time I lifted up mine eyes and saw in a dream, and behold, the he goats leaped upon the she goats, that were parti-colored with little and great spots spotted.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the Angel of God said to me in a dream, Jacob. And I answered, Lo, I am here.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he said, Lift up now thine eyes, and see all the he goats leaping upon the she goats that are parti-colored, spotted with little and great spots: for I have seen all that Laban doeth unto thee.
speaker: Narrator

text: I am the God of Bethel, where thou anointedst the pillar, where thou vowedst a vow unto me. Now arise, get thee out of this country and return unto the land where thou wast born.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then answered Rachel and Leah, and said unto him, Have we any more portion and inheritance in our father’s house?
speaker: Narrator

text: Doth not he count us as strangers? for he hath sold us, and hath eaten up and consumed our money.
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore all the riches, which God hath taken from our father, is ours and our children’s: now then whatsoever God hath said unto thee, do it.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Jacob rose up, and set his sons and his wives upon camels.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he carried away all his flocks, and all his substance which he had gotten, to wit, his riches, which he had gotten in Padan Aram, to go to Isaac his father unto the land of Canaan.
speaker: Narrator

text: When Laban was gone to sheer his sheep, then Rachel stole her father’s idols.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thus Jacob stole away the heart of Laban the Aramite: for he told him not that he fled.
speaker: Narrator

text: So fled he with all that he had, and he rose up, and passed the river, and set his face toward mount Gilead.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the third day after was it told Laban, that Jacob fled.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then he took his brethren with him and followed after him seven days journey, and overtook him at mount Gilead.
speaker: Narrator

text: And God came to Laban the Aramite in a dream by night, and said unto him, Take heed that thou speak not to Jacob ought save good.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Laban overtook Jacob, and Jacob had pitched his tent in the mount: and Laban also with his brethren pitched upon mount Gilead.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Laban said to Jacob, What hast thou done? thou hast even stolen away mine heart and carried away my daughters as though they had been taken captives with the sword.
speaker: Narrator

text: Wherefore diddest thou flee so secretly and steal away from me, and diddest not tell me, that I might have sent thee forth with mirth and with songs, with timbrell and with harp?
speaker: Narrator

text: But thou hast not suffered me to kiss my sons and my daughters: now thou hast done foolishly in doing so.
speaker: Narrator

text: I am able to do you evil: but the God of your father spake unto me yesternight, saying, Take heed that thou speak not to Jacob ought save good.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now though thou wentest thy way, because thou greatly longedst after thy father’s house, yet wherefore hast thou stolen my gods?
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Jacob answered, and said to Laban, Because I was afraid, and thought that thou wouldest have taken thy daughters from me.
speaker: Narrator

text: But with whom thou findest thy gods, let him not live. Search thou before our brethren what I have of thine, and take it to thee, (but Jacob wist not that Rachel had stolen them.)
speaker: Narrator

text: Then came Laban into Jacob’s tent, and into Leah’s tent, and into the two maid’s tents, but found them not. So he went out of Leah’s tent, and entered into Rachel’s tent.
speaker: Narrator

text: (Now Rachel had taken the idols, and put them in the camel’s litter and sat down upon them) and Laban searched all the tent, but found them not.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then said she to her father, My Lord, be not angry that I cannot rise up before thee: for the custom of women is upon me: so he searched, but found not the idols.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Jacob was wroth, and chode with Laban: Jacob also answered and said to Laban, What have I trespassed? what have I offended, that thou hast pursued after me?
speaker: Narrator

text: Seeing thou hast searched all my stuff, what hast thou found of all thine household stuff? put it here before my brethren and thy brethren, that they may judge between us both.
speaker: Narrator

text: This twenty years I have been with thee: thine ewes and thy goats have not cast their young, and the rams of thy flock have I not eaten.
speaker: Narrator

text: Whatsoever was torn of beasts, I brought it not unto thee, but made it good myself: of mine hand diddest thou require it, were it stolen by day, or stolen by night.
speaker: Narrator

text: I was in the day consumed with heat, and with frost in the night, and my sleep departed from mine eyes.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thus have I been twenty years in thine house, and served thee fourteen years for thy two daughters, and six years for thy sheep, and thou hast changed my wages ten times.
speaker: Narrator

text: Except the God of my father, the God of Abraham, and the fear of Isaac had been with me, surely thou haddest sent me away now empty: but God beheld my tribulation, and the labor of mine hands, and rebuked thee yesternight.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Laban answered, and said unto Jacob, These daughters are my daughters, and these sons are my sons, and these sheep are my sheep, and all that thou seest, is mine, and what can I do this day unto these my daughters, or to their sons which they have borne?
speaker: Narrator

text: Now therefore come let us make a covenant, I and thou, which may be a witness between me and thee.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then took Jacob a stone, and set it up as a pillar:
speaker: Narrator

text: And Jacob said unto his brethren, Gather stones: who brought stones, and made a heap, and they did eat there upon the heap.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Laban called it Jegar Sahadutha, and Jacob called it Galeed.
speaker: Narrator

text: For Laban said, This heap is witness between me and thee this day: therefore he called the name of it Galeed.
speaker: Narrator

text: Also he called it Mizpah, because he said, The Lord look between me and he, when we shall be departed one from another.
speaker: Narrator

text: If thou shalt vex my daughters, or shalt take wives beside my daughters: there is no man with us, behold, God is witness between me and thee.
speaker: Narrator

text: Moreover Laban said to Jacob, Behold this heap, and behold the pillar, which I have set between me and thee.
speaker: Narrator

text: This heap shall be witness, and the pillar shall be witness, that I will not come over this heap to thee, and that thou shalt not pass over this heap and this pillar unto me for evil.
speaker: Narrator

text: The God of Abraham, and the God of Nahor, and the God of their father be judge between us: but Jacob sware by the fear of his father Isaac.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Jacob did offer a sacrifice upon the mount, and called his brethren to eat bread, and they did eat bread, and tarried all night in the mount.
speaker: Narrator

text: And early in the morning Laban rose up and kissed his sons, and his daughters, and blessed them, and Laban departing, went unto his place again.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now Jacob went forth on his journey, and the Angels of God met him.
speaker: Narrator

text: And when Jacob saw them, he said, This is God’s host: and he called the name of the same place Mahanaim.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Jacob sent messengers before him to Esau his brother, unto the land of Seir into the country of Edom.
speaker: Narrator

text: To whom he gave commandment, saying, Thus shall ye speak to my lord Esau: thy servant Jacob saith thus, I have been a stranger with Laban, and tarried unto this time.
speaker: Narrator

text: I have beeves also and asses, sheep, and men servants, and women servants, and have sent to show my lord, that I may find grace in thy sight.
speaker: Narrator

text: So the messengers came again to Jacob, saying, We came unto thy brother Esau, and he also cometh against thee and four hundred men with him.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Jacob was greatly afraid, and was sore troubled, and divided the people that was with him, and the sheep, and the beeves, and the camels into two companies.
speaker: Narrator

text: For he said, If Esau come to the one company and smite it, the other company shall escape.
speaker: Narrator

text: Moreover Jacob said, O God of my father Abraham, and God of my father Isaac, Lord, which saidst unto me, Return unto thy country, and to thy kindred, and I will do thee good.
speaker: Narrator

text: I am not worthy of the least of all the mercies, and all the truth, which thou hast showed unto thy servant: for with my staff came I over this Jordan, and now have I gotten two bands.
speaker: Narrator

text: I pray thee, Deliver me from the hand of my brother, from the hand of Esau: for I fear him, lest he will come and smite me, and the mother upon the children.
speaker: Narrator

text: And thou saidest, I will surely do to thee good, and make thy seed as the sand of the sea, which cannot be numbered for multitude.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he tarried there that same night and took of that which came to hand, a present for Esau his brother:
speaker: Narrator

text: Two hundred she goats, and twenty he goats, two hundred ewes and twenty rams:
speaker: Narrator

text: Thirty milch camels with their colts, forty kine, and ten bullocks, twenty she asses, and ten foals.
speaker: Narrator

text: So he delivered them into the hand of his servants, every drove by themselves, and said unto his servants, Pass before me, and put a space between drove and drove.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he commanded the foremost, saying, If my brother Esau meet thee, and ask thee, saying, Whose servant art thou? And whither goest thou? and whose are these before thee?
speaker: Narrator

text: Then thou shalt say, They be thy servant Jacob’s: it is a present sent unto my lord Esau: and behold, he himself also is behind us.
speaker: Narrator

text: So likewise commanded he the second and the third, and all that followed the droves, saying, After this manner, ye shall speak unto Esau, when ye find him.
speaker: Narrator

text: And ye shall say moreover, Behold, thy servant Jacob cometh after us. (for he thought, I will appease his wrath with the present that goeth before me, and afterward I will see his face: it may be that he will accept me.)
speaker: Narrator

text: So went the present before him: but he tarried that night with the company.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he rose up the same night, and took his two wives, and his two maids, and his eleven children, and went over the ford Jabbok.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he took them, and sent them over the river, and sent over that he had.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now when Jacob was left himself alone, there wrestled a man with him unto the breaking of the day.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he saw that he could not prevail against him: therefore he touched the hollow of his thigh, and the hollow of Jacob’s thigh was loosed, as he wrestled with him.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he said, Let me go, for the morning appeareth. Who answered, I will not let thee go, except thou bless me.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then said he unto him, What is thy name? And he said, Jacob.
speaker: Narrator

text: And said he, Thy name shall be called Jacob no more, but Israel: because thou hast had power with God, thou shalt also prevail with men.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Jacob demanded, saying, Tell me, I pray thee, thy name. And he said, Wherefore now dost thou ask my name? and he blessed him there.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Jacob called the name of the place, Peniel: for, said he, I have seen God face to face, and my life is preserved.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the sun rose up to him as he passed Peniel, and he halted upon his thigh.
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore the children of Israel eat not of the sinew which shrank in the hollow of the thigh, unto this day: because he touched the sinew that shrank in the hollow of Jacob’s thigh.
speaker: Narrator

text: And as Jacob lifted up his eyes, and looked, behold, Esau came, and with him four hundred men: and he divided the children to Leah, and unto Rachel, and to the two maids.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he put the maids, and their children foremost, and Leah, and her children after, and Rachel and Joseph hindermost.
speaker: Narrator

text: So he went before them and bowed himself to the ground seven times, until he came near to his brother.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Esau ran to meet him, and embraced him, and fell on his neck, and kissed him, and they wept.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he lifted up his eyes, and saw the women, and the children, and said, Who are these with thee? And he answered, They are the children whom God of his grace hath given thy servant.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then came the maids near, they and their children, and bowed themselves.
speaker: Narrator

text: Leah also with her children came near and made obeisance: and after Joseph and Rachel drew near, and did reverence.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then he said, What meanest thou by all this drove, which I met? Who answered, I have sent it, that I may find favor in the sight of my lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Esau said, I have enough, my brother: keep that thou hast to thyself.
speaker: Narrator

text: But Jacob answered, Nay, I pray thee, if I have found grace now in thy sight, then receive my present at my hand: for I have seen thy face, as though I had seen the face of God, because thou hast accepted me.
speaker: Narrator

text: I pray thee take my blessing, that is brought thee: for God hath had mercy on me, and therefore I have all things: for he compelled him, and he took it.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he said, Let us take our journey and go, and I will go before thee.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then he answered him, My lord knoweth, that the children are tender, and the ewes and kine with young under mine hand: and if they should overdrive them one day, all the flock would die.
speaker: Narrator

text: Let now my lord go before his servant, and I will drive softly, according to the pace of the cattle, which is before me, and as the children be able to endure, until I come to my lord unto Seir.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Esau said, I will leave then some of my folk with thee. And he answered, What needeth this? let me find grace in the sight of my lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: So Esau returned, and went his way that same day unto Seir.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Jacob went forward toward Succoth, and built him an house, and made booths for his cattle: therefore he called the name of the place Succoth.
speaker: Narrator

text: Afterward, Jacob came safe to Shechem a city, which is in the land of Canaan, when he came from Padan Aram, and pitched before the city.
speaker: Narrator

text: And there he bought a parcel of ground, where he pitched his tent, at the hand of the sons of Hamor Shechem’s father, for an hundred pieces of money.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he set up there an altar, and called it, The mighty God of Israel.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Dinah the daughter of Leah, which she bare unto Jacob, went out to see the daughters of that country.
speaker: Narrator

text: Whom when Shechem the son of Hamor the Hivite lord of that country saw, he took her, and lay with her, and defiled her.
speaker: Narrator

text: So his heart clave unto Dinah the daughter of Jacob: and he loved the maid, and spake kindly to the maid.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then said Shechem to his father Hamor, saying, Get me this maid to wife.
speaker: Narrator

text: (Now Jacob heard that he had defiled Dinah his daughter, and his sons were with his cattle in the field: therefore Jacob held his peace, until they were come.)
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Hamor the father of Shechem went out unto Jacob to commune with him.
speaker: Narrator

text: And when the sons of Jacob were come out of the field and heard it, it grieved the men, and they were very angry, because he had wrought villany in Israel, in that he had lain with Jacob’s daughter: which thing ought not to be done.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Hamor communed with them, saying, The soul of my son: Shechem longeth for your daughter, give her him to wife, I pray you.
speaker: Narrator

text: So make affinity with us, give your daughters unto us, and take our daughters unto you.
speaker: Narrator

text: And ye shall dwell with us, and the land shall be before you, dwell, and do your business in it, and have your possessions therein.
speaker: Narrator

text: Shechem also said unto her father and unto her brethren, Let me find favor in your eyes, and I will give whatsoever ye shall appoint me.
speaker: Narrator

text: Ask of me abundantly both dowry, and gifts, and I will give as ye appoint me, so that ye give me the maid to wife.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then the sons of Jacob answered, Shechem and Hamor his father, talking deceitfully, because he had defiled their sister:
speaker: Narrator

text: And they said unto them, We cannot do this thing, to give our sister to an uncircumcised man: for that were a reproof unto us.
speaker: Narrator

text: But in this we will consent unto you, if ye will be as we are, that every man child among you be circumcised,
speaker: Narrator

text: Then will we give our daughters to you, and we will take your daughters to us, and will dwell with you, and be one people.
speaker: Narrator

text: But if ye will not hearken unto us to be circumcised, then will we take our daughter and depart.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now their words pleased Hamor, and Shechem Hamor’s son.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the young man deferred not to do the thing because he loved Jacob’s daughter: he was also the most set by of all his father’s house.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Hamor and Shechem his Son went unto the gate of their city, and communed with the men of their city, saying,
speaker: Narrator

text: These men are peaceable with us: and that they may dwell in the land, and do their affairs therein (for behold, the land hath room enough for them) let us take their daughters to wives, and give them our daughters.
speaker: Narrator

text: Only herein will the men consent unto us for to dwell with us, and to be one people, if all the men children among us be circumcised as they are circumcised.
speaker: Narrator

text: Shall not their flocks and their substance and all their cattle be ours? only let us consent herein unto them and they will dwell with us.
speaker: Narrator

text: And unto Hamor, and Shechem his son hearkened all that went out of the gate of his city: and all the men children were circumcised, even all that went out of the gate of his city.
speaker: Narrator

text: And on the third day (when they were sore) two of the sons of Jacob, Simeon and Levi, Dinah’s brethren took either of them his sword and went into the city boldly, and slew every male.
speaker: Narrator

text: They slew also Hamor and Shechem his son with the edge of the sword, and took Dinah out of Shechem’s house, and went their way.
speaker: Narrator

text: Again, the other sons of Jacob came upon the dead, and spoiled the city, because they had defiled their sister.
speaker: Narrator

text: They took their sheep and their beeves, and their asses, and whatsoever was in the city and in the fields.
speaker: Narrator

text: Also they carried away captive and spoiled all their goods, and all their children and their wives, and all that was in the houses.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Jacob said to Simeon and Levi, Ye have troubled me, and made me stink among the inhabitants of the land, as well the Canaanites, as the Perizzites, and I being few in number, they shall gather themselves together against me, and slay me, and so shall I, and my house be destroyed.
speaker: Narrator

text: And they answered, Should he abuse our sister as a whore?
speaker: Narrator

text: Then God said to Jacob, Arise, go up to Bethel and dwell there, and make there an altar unto God, that appeared unto thee, when thou fleddest from Esau thy brother.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then said Jacob unto his household and to all that were with him, Put away the strange gods that are among you, and cleanse yourselves, and change your garments:
speaker: Narrator

text: For we will rise and go up to Bethel, and I will make an altar there unto God, which heard me in the day of my tribulation, and was with me in the way which I went.
speaker: Narrator

text: And they gave unto Jacob all the strange gods, which were in their hands, and all their earrings which were in their ears, and Jacob hid them under an oak, which was by Shechem.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then they went on their journey, and the fear of God was upon the cities that were round about them: so that they did not follow after the sons of Jacob.
speaker: Narrator

text: So came Jacob to Luz, which is in the land of Canaan: (the same is Bethel) he and all the people that were with him.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he built there an altar, and had called the place, The God of Bethel, because that God appeared unto him there, when he fled from his brother.
speaker: Narrator

text: But Deborah Rebekah’s nurse died, and was buried beneath Bethel under an oak: and he called the name of it Allon Bachuth.
speaker: Narrator

text: Again God appeared unto Jacob, after he came to Padan Aram, and blessed him.
speaker: Narrator

text: Moreover God said unto him, Thy name is Jacob: thy name shall be no more called Jacob, but Israel shall be thy name: and he called his name Israel.
speaker: Narrator

text: And God said unto him, I am God all-sufficient: grow, and multiply: a nation and a multitude of nations shall spring of thee, and kings shall come out of thy loins.
speaker: Narrator

text: Also I will give the land, which I gave to Abraham and Isaac, unto thee: and unto thy seed after thee will I give that land.
speaker: Narrator

text: So God ascended from him in the place where he had talked with him.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Jacob set up a pillar in the place where he talked with him, a pillar of stone, and poured drink offerings thereon: also he poured oil thereon.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Jacob called the name of that place where God spake with him, Bethel.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then they departed from Bethel, and when there was about half a day’s journey of ground to come to Ephrath, Rachel travailed, and in travailing she was in peril.
speaker: Narrator

text: And when she was in the pains of her labor, the midwife said unto her, Fear not, for thou shalt have this son also.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then as she was about to yield up the ghost (for she died) she called his name Ben-Oni, but his father called him Benjamin.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thus died Rachel and was buried in the way to Ephrath, which is Bethlehem.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Jacob set a pillar upon her grave: This is the pillar of Rachel’s grave unto this day.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Israel went forward, and pitched his tent beyond Migdal Eder.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now when Israel dwelt in that land, Reuben went and lay with Bilhah his father’s concubine, and it came to Israel’s ear. And Jacob had twelve sons.
speaker: Narrator

text: The sons of Leah: Reuben Jacob’s eldest son, and Simeon, and Levi, and Judah, and Issachar, and Zebulun:
speaker: Narrator

text: The sons of Rachel; Joseph, and Benjamin:
speaker: Narrator

text: And the sons of Bilhah Rachel’s maid: Dan and Naphtali:
speaker: Narrator

text: And the sons of Zilpah Leah’s maid: Gad and Asher. These are the sons of Jacob, which were born him in Padan Aram.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Jacob came unto Isaac his father unto Mamre a city of Kirjath Arbah: that is Hebron, where Abraham and Isaac were strangers.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the days of Isaac were an hundred and fourscore years.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Isaac gave up the ghost and died, and was gathered unto his people, being old and full of days: and his sons Esau and Jacob buried him.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now these are the generations of Esau, which is Edom.
speaker: Narrator

text: Esau took his wives of the daughters of Canaan: Adah the daughter of Elon an Hittite and Aholibamah the daughter of Anah, the daughter of Zibeon an Hivite.
speaker: Narrator

text: And took Basemath Ishmael’s daughter, sister of Nebajoth.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Adah bare unto Esau, Eliphaz: and Basemath bare Reuel,
speaker: Narrator

text: Also Aholibamah bare Jeush, and Jaalam, and Korah: these are the sons of Esau which were born to him in the land of Canaan.
speaker: Narrator

text: So Esau took his wives and his sons, and his daughters, and all the souls of his house, and his flocks, and all his cattle, and all his substance, which he had gotten in the land of Canaan, and went into another country from his brother Jacob.
speaker: Narrator

text: For their riches were so great, that they could not dwell together, and the land, wherein they were strangers, could not receive them because of their flocks.
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore dwelt Esau in mount Seir: this Esau is Edom.
speaker: Narrator

text: So these are the generations of Esau father of Edom in mount Seir:
speaker: Narrator

text: These are the names of Esau’s sons: Eliphaz, the son of Adah, the wife of Esau, and Reuel the son of Basemath, the wife of Esau.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the sons of Eliphaz were Teman, Omar, Zepho, and Gatam, and Kenaz.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Timna was concubine to Eliphaz Esau’s son, and bare unto Eliphaz, Amalek: these be the sons of Adah Esau’s wife.
speaker: Narrator

text: And these are the sons of Reuel: Nahath, and Zerah, Shammah, and Mizzah: these be the sons of Basemath Esau’s wife.
speaker: Narrator

text: And these were the sons of Aholibamah the daughter of Anah, daughter of Zibeon Esau’s wife: for she bare unto Esau, Jeush, and Jaalam, and Korah.
speaker: Narrator

text: These were Dukes of the sons of Esau the sons of Eliphaz, the firstborn of Esau Duke Teman, Duke Omar, Duke Zepho, Duke Kenaz,
speaker: Narrator

text: Duke Korah, Duke Gatam, and Duke Amalek: these are the Dukes that came of Eliphaz in the land of Edom: these were the sons of Adah.
speaker: Narrator

text: And these are the sons of Reuel Esau’s son: Duke Nahath, Duke Zerah, Duke Shammah, Duke Mizzah: these are the Dukes that came of Reuel in the land of Edom: these are the sons of Basemath Esau’s wife.
speaker: Narrator
