text: Likewise these were the sons of Aholibamah Esau’s wife: Duke Jeush, Duke Jaalam, Duke Korah: these Dukes came of Aholibamah, the daughter of Anah Esau’s wife.
speaker: Narrator

text: These are the children of Esau, and these are the Dukes of them: This Esau is Edom.
speaker: Narrator

text: These are the sons of Seir the Horite, which inhabited the land before Lotan, and Shobal, and Zibeon, and Anah,
speaker: Narrator

text: And Dishon, and Ezer, and Dishan: these are the Dukes of the Horites, the sons of Seir in the land of Edom.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the sons of Lotan were, Hori and Hemam, and Lotan’s sister was Timna.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the sons of Shobal were these: Alvan, and Manahath, and Ebal, Shepho, and Onam.
speaker: Narrator

text: And these are the sons of Zibeon: Both Ajah, and Anah: this was Anah that found mules in the wilderness, as he fed his father Zibeon’s asses.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the children of Anah were these: Dishon and Aholibamah, the daughter of Anah.
speaker: Narrator

text: Also these are the sons of Dishon: Hemdan, and Eshban, and Ithran, and Cheran.
speaker: Narrator

text: The sons of Ezer are these: Bilhan, and Zaavan, and Akan.
speaker: Narrator

text: The sons of Dishan are these, Uz, and Aran.
speaker: Narrator

text: These are the Dukes of the Horites: Duke Lotan, Duke Shobal, Duke Zibeon, Duke Anah,
speaker: Narrator

text: Duke Dishon, Duke Ezer, Duke Dishan: these be the Dukes of the Horites, after their Dukedoms in the land of Seir.
speaker: Narrator

text: And these are the Kings that reigned in the land of Edom, before there reigned any King over the children of Israel.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Bela the son of Beor reigned in Edom, and the name of his city was Dinhabah.
speaker: Narrator

text: And when Bela died, Jobab the son of Zerah of Bozrah reigned in his stead.
speaker: Narrator

text: When Jobab also was dead, Husham of the land of Temani reigned in his stead.
speaker: Narrator

text: And after the death of Husham, Hadad the son of Bedad, which slew Midian in the field of Moab, reigned in his stead, and the name of his city was Avith.
speaker: Narrator

text: When Hadad was dead, then Samlah of Masrekah reigned in his stead.
speaker: Narrator

text: When Samlah was dead, Saul of Rehoboth by the river, reigned in his stead.
speaker: Narrator

text: When Saul died, Baal-Hanan the son of Achbor reigned in his stead.
speaker: Narrator

text: And after the death of Baal-Hanan the son of Achbor, Hadar reigned in his stead, and the name of his city was Pau: and his wife’s name Mehetabel the daughter of Matred, the daughter of Mezahab.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then these are the names of the Dukes of Esau according to their families, their places, and by their names: Duke Timnah, Duke Alvah, Duke Jetheth.
speaker: Narrator

text: Duke Aholibamah, Duke Elah, Duke Pinon,
speaker: Narrator

text: Duke Kenaz, Duke Teman, Duke Mibzar,
speaker: Narrator

text: Duke Magdiel, Duke Iram: these be the Dukes of Edom, according to their habitations, in the land of their inheritance. This Esau is the father of Edom.
speaker: Narrator

text: Jacob now dwelt in the land, wherein his father was a stranger, in the land of Canaan.
speaker: Narrator

text: These are the generations of Jacob when Joseph was seventeen years old, he kept sheep with his brethren, and the child was with the sons of Bilhah, and with the sons of Zilpah, his father’s wives, And Joseph brought unto their father their evil saying.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now Israel loved Joseph more than all his sons, because he begat him in his old age and he made him a coat of many colors.
speaker: Narrator

text: So when his brethren saw that their father loved him more than all his brethren, then they hated him, and could not speak peaceably unto him.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Joseph dreamed a dream, and told his brethren, who hated him so much the more.
speaker: Narrator

text: For he said unto them, Hear, I pray you this dream which I have dreamed.
speaker: Narrator

text: Behold now, we were binding sheaves in the midst of the field: and lo, my sheaf arose and also stood upright, and behold, your sheaves compassed round about, and did reverence to my sheaf.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then his brethren said to him, What, shalt thou reign over us, and rule us? or shalt thou have altogether dominion over us? And they hated him so much the more, for his dreams, and for his words.
speaker: Narrator

text: Again he dreamed another dream, and told it his brethren, and said, Behold, I have had one dream more, and behold, the Sun and the Moon and eleven stars did reverence to me.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then he told it unto his father and to his brethren, and his father rebuked him, and said unto him, What is this thy dream, which thou hast dreamed? shall I, and thy mother, and thy brethren come indeed and fall on the ground before thee?
speaker: Narrator

text: And his brethren envied him, but his father noted the saying.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then his brethren went to keep their father’s sheep in Shechem.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Israel said unto Joseph, Do not thy brethren keep in Shechem? come and I will send thee to them.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he answered him, I am here. Then he said unto him, Go now, see whether it be well with thy brethren, and how the flocks prosper, and bring me word again: so he sent him from the vale of Hebron, and he came to Shechem.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then a man found him: for lo, he was wandering in the field, and the man asked him, saying, what seekest thou?
speaker: Narrator

text: And he answered, I seek my brethren: tell me, I pray thee, where they keep sheep.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the man said, they are departed hence: for I heard them say, Let us go unto Dothan. Then went Joseph after his brethren, and found them in Dothan.
speaker: Narrator

text: And when they saw him afar off, even before he came at them, they conspired against him for to slay him.
speaker: Narrator

text: For they said one to another, Behold, this dreamer cometh.
speaker: Narrator

text: Come now therefore, and let us slay him, and cast him into some pit, and we will say, A wicked beast hath devoured him: then we shall see, what will come of his dreams.
speaker: Narrator

text: But when Reuben heard that, he delivered him out of their hands, and said, Let us not kill him.
speaker: Narrator

text: Also Reuben said unto them, Shed not blood, but cast him into this pit that is in the wilderness, and lay no hand upon him. Thus he said, that he might deliver him out of their hand, and restore him to his father.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now when Joseph was come unto his brethren, they stripped Joseph out of his coat, his parti-colored coat that was upon him.
speaker: Narrator

text: And they took him, and cast him into a pit, and the pit was empty, without water in it.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then they sat them down to eat bread: and lift up their eyes and looked, and behold, there came a company of Ishmaelites from Gilead, and their camels laden with spicery, and balm, and myrrh, and were going to carry it down into Egypt.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Judah said to his brethren, What availeth it, if we slay our brother, though we keep his blood secret?
speaker: Narrator

text: Come and let us sell him to the Ishmaelites, and let not our hands be upon him: for he is our brother, and our flesh: and his brethren obeyed.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then the Midianites’ merchant men passed by, and they drew forth, and lift Joseph out of the pit, and sold Joseph to the Ishmaelites for twenty pieces of silver: who brought Joseph into Egypt.
speaker: Narrator

text: Afterward Reuben returned to the pit, and behold, Joseph was not in the pit: then he rent his clothes,
speaker: Narrator

text: And returned to his brethren, and said, The child is not yonder, and I, whither shall I go?
speaker: Narrator

text: And they took Joseph’s coat, and killed a kid of the goats, and dipped the coat in the blood.
speaker: Narrator

text: So they sent that parti-colored coat, and they brought it unto their father, and said, This have we found: see now, whether it be thy son’s coat, or no.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then he knew it, and said, It is my son’s coat: a wicked beast hath devoured him: Joseph is surely torn in pieces.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Jacob rent his clothes, and put sackcloth about his loins, and sorrowed for his son a long season.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then all his sons and his daughters arose up to comfort him, but he would not be comforted, but said, Surely I will go down into the grave unto my son mourning: so his father wept for him.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the Midianites sold him into Egypt unto Potiphar an Eunuch of Pharaoh’s and his chief steward.
speaker: Narrator

text: And at that time Judah went down from his brethren, and turned into a man called Hirah an Adullamite.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Judah saw there a daughter of a man called Shua a Canaanite: and he took her to wife, and went into her.
speaker: Narrator

text: So she conceived and bare a son, and he called his name Er.
speaker: Narrator

text: And she conceived again and bare a son, and she called his name Onan.
speaker: Narrator

text: Moreover she bare yet a son, whom she called Shelah: and Judah was at Chezib when she bare him.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Judah took a wife to Er his firstborn son, whose name was Tamar.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now Er the firstborn of Judah was wicked in the sight of the Lord: therefore the Lord slew him.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Judah said to Onan, Go in unto thy brother’s wife, and do the office of a kinsman unto her, and raise up seed unto thy brother.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Onan knew that the seed should not be his: therefore when he went in unto his brother’s wife, he spilled it on the ground, lest that he should give seed to his brother.
speaker: Narrator

text: And it was wicked in the eyes of the Lord, which he did: wherefore he slew him also.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Judah said to Tamar his daughter-in-law, Remain a widow in thy father’s house, till Shelah my son grow up (for he thought thus, Lest he die as well as his brethren,) So Tamar went and dwelt in her father’s house.
speaker: Narrator

text: And in process of time also the daughter of Shua Judah’s wife died. Then Judah, when he had left mourning, went up to his sheepshearers to Timnah, he, and his neighbor Hirah the Adullamite.
speaker: Narrator

text: And it was told Tamar, saying, Behold, thy father-in-law goeth up to Timnath, to shear his sheep.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then she put her widow’s garments off from her, and covered her with a veil, and wrapped herself, and sat down in Pethah-enam which is by the way to Timnah, because she saw that Shelah was grown, and she was not given unto him to wife.
speaker: Narrator

text: When Judah saw her, he judged her an whore: for she had covered her face.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he turned to the way towards her, and said, Come, I pray thee, let me lie with thee, (for he knew not that she was his daughter-in-law.) And she answered, What wilt thou give me for to lie with me?
speaker: Narrator

text: Then said he, I will send thee a kid of the goats from the flock, and she said, Well, if thou wilt give me a pledge, till thou send it.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then he said, What is the pledge that I shall give thee? And she answered, Thy signet and thy cloak and thy staff that is in thine hand. So he gave it her, and lay by her, and she was with child by him.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then she rose, and went and put her veil from her and put on her widow’s raiment.
speaker: Narrator

text: Afterward Judah sent a kid of the goats by the hand of his neighbor the Adullamite, for to receive his pledge from the woman’s hand: but he found her not.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then asked he the men of the place, saying, Where is the whore, that sat in Enaim by the wayside? and they answered, There was no whore there.
speaker: Narrator

text: He came therefore to Judah again, and said, I cannot find her, and also the men of the place said, There was no whore there.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Judah said, Let her take it to her, lest we be shamed: behold, I sent this kid, and thou hast not found her.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now after three months, one told Judah, saying, Tamar thy daughter-in-law hath played the whore, and lo, with playing the whore, she is great with child. Then Judah said, Bring ye her forth and let her be burnt.
speaker: Narrator

text: When she was brought forth, she sent to her father-in-law, saying, By the man, unto whom these things pertain, am I with child: and said also, Look I pray thee, whose these are, the seal, and the cloak, and the staff.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Judah knew them, and said, She is more righteous than I: for she hath done it because I gave her not to Shelah my son. So he lay with her no more.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now, when the time was come that she should be delivered, behold, there were twins in her womb.
speaker: Narrator

text: And when she was in travail, the one put out his hand: and the midwife took and bound a red thread about his hand, saying, this is come out first.
speaker: Narrator

text: But when he plucked his hand back again, lo, his brother came out, and the midwife said, How hast thou broken the breach upon thee? and his name was called Perez.
speaker: Narrator

text: And afterward came out his brother that had the red thread about his hand, and his name was called Zerah.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now Joseph was brought down into Egypt: and Potiphar an Eunuch of Pharaoh’s (and his chief steward an Egyptian) bought him at the hand of the Ishmaelites, which had brought him thither.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the Lord was with Joseph, and he was a man that prospered and was in the house of his master the Egyptian.
speaker: Narrator

text: And his master saw that the Lord was with him, and that the Lord made all that he did to prosper in his hand.
speaker: Narrator

text: So Joseph found favor in his sight, and served him: and made him ruler of his house, and put all that he had in his hand.
speaker: Narrator

text: And from that time that he had made him ruler over his house and over all that he had, the Lord blessed the Egyptian’s house for Joseph’s sake: and the blessing of the Lord was upon all that he had in the house, and in the field.
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore he left all that he had in Joseph’s hand, and took account of nothing, that was with him, save only of the bread, which he did eat. And Joseph was a fair person, and well favored.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now therefore after these things, his master’s wife cast her eyes upon Joseph, and said, Lie with me.
speaker: Narrator

text: But he refused and said to his master’s wife, Behold, my master knoweth not what he hath in the house with me, but hath committed all that he had to mine hand.
speaker: Narrator

text: There is no man greater in this house than I: neither hath he kept anything from me, but only thee, because thou art his wife: how then can I do this great wickedness and so sin against God?
speaker: Narrator

text: And albeit she spake to Joseph day by day, yet he hearkened not unto her, to lie with her, or to be in her company.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then on a certain day Joseph entered into the house to do his business: and there was no man of the household in the house.
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore she caught him by his garment, saying, Sleep with me: but he left his garment in her hand and fled, and got him out.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now when she saw that he had left his garment in her hand, and was fled out,
speaker: Narrator

text: She called unto the men of her house, and told them, saying, Behold, he hath brought in an Hebrew unto us to mock us: who came in to me for to have slept with me: but I cried with a loud voice.
speaker: Narrator

text: And when he heard that I lift up my voice and cried, he left his garments with me, and fled away, and got him out.
speaker: Narrator

text: So she laid up his garment by her, until her lord came home.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then she told him according to these words, saying, The Hebrew servant, which thou hast brought unto us, came into me, to mock me.
speaker: Narrator

text: But as soon as I lift up my voice and cried, he left his garment with me, and fled out.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then when his master heard the words of his wife, which she told him, saying, After this manner did thy servant to me, his anger was kindled.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Joseph’s master took him and put him in prison, in the place, where the king’s prisoners lay bound: and there he was in prison.
speaker: Narrator

text: But the Lord was with Joseph, and showed him mercy, and got him favor in the sight of the master of the prison.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the keeper of the prison committed to Joseph’s hand all the prisoners that were in the prison, and whatsoever they did there, that did he.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the keeper of the prison looked unto nothing that was under his hand, seeing that the Lord was with him: for whatsoever he did, the Lord made it to prosper.
speaker: Narrator

text: And after these things, the butler of the King of Egypt and his baker offended their Lord the King of Egypt.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Pharaoh was angry against his two Officers, against the chief butler, and against the chief baker.
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore he put them in ward in his chief steward’s house, in the prison and place where Joseph was bound.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the chief steward gave Joseph charge over them, and he served them: and they continued a season in ward.
speaker: Narrator

text: And they both dreamed a dream, either of them his dream in one night, each one according to the interpretation of his dream, both the butler and the baker of the King of Egypt, which were bound in the prison.
speaker: Narrator

text: And when Joseph came in unto them in the morning, and looked upon them, behold, they were sad.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he asked Pharaoh’s officers, that were with him in his master’s ward, saying, Wherefore look ye so sadly today?
speaker: Narrator

text: Who answered him, We have dreamed each one a dream, and there is none to interpret the same. Then Joseph said unto them, Are not interpretations of God? tell them me now.
speaker: Narrator

text: So the chief butler told his dream to Joseph, and said unto him, In my dream, behold, a vine was before me,
speaker: Narrator

text: And in the vine were three branches, and as it budded, her flower came forth: and the clusters of grapes waxed ripe.
speaker: Narrator

text: And I had Pharaoh’s cup in mine hand, and I took the grapes, and wrung them into Pharaoh’s cup, and I gave the cup into Pharaoh’s hand.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Joseph said unto him, This is the interpretation of it: the three branches are three days.
speaker: Narrator

text: Within three days shall Pharaoh lift up thine head, and restore thee unto thine office, and thou shalt give Pharaoh’s cup into his hand after the old manner, when thou wast his butler,
speaker: Narrator

text: But have me in remembrance with thee, when thou art in good case, and show mercy, I pray thee unto me, and make mention of me to Pharaoh, that thou mayest bring me out of this house.
speaker: Narrator

text: For I was stolen away by theft out of the land of the Hebrews, and here also have I done nothing, wherefore they should put me in the dungeon.
speaker: Narrator

text: And when the chief baker saw that the interpretation was good, he said unto Joseph, Also me thought in my dream that I had three white baskets on mine head.
speaker: Narrator

text: And in the uppermost basket there was of all manner bakemeats for Pharaoh: and the birds did eat them out of the basket upon mine head.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Joseph answered, and said, This is the interpretation thereof: The three baskets are three days:
speaker: Narrator

text: Within three days shall Pharaoh take thine head from thee, and shall hang thee on a tree and the birds shall eat thy flesh from off thee.
speaker: Narrator

text: And so the third day, which was Pharaoh’s birthday, he made a feast unto all his servants: and he lifted up the head of the chief butler, and the chief baker among his servants.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he restored the chief butler unto his butlership, who gave the cup into Pharaoh’s hand.
speaker: Narrator

text: But he hanged the chief baker, as Joseph had interpreted unto them.
speaker: Narrator

text: Yet the chief butler did not remember Joseph, but forgot him.
speaker: Narrator

text: And two years after, Pharaoh also dreamed, and behold, he stood by a river.
speaker: Narrator

text: And lo, there came out of the river seven goodly kine and fat-fleshed, and they fed in a meadow.
speaker: Narrator

text: And lo, seven other kine came up after them out of the river, evil favored and lean fleshed, and stood by the other kine upon the brink of the river.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the evil favored and lean fleshed kine did eat up the seven well favored and fat kine: so Pharaoh awoke.
speaker: Narrator

text: Again he slept, and dreamed the second time: and behold, seven ears of corn grew upon one stalk, rank and goodly.
speaker: Narrator

text: And lo, seven thin ears, and blasted with the East wind, sprang up after them.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the thin ears devoured the seven rank and full ears, then Pharaoh awaked, and lo it was a dream.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now when the morning came, his spirit was troubled: therefore he sent and called all the soothsayers of Egypt, and all the wise men thereof, and Pharaoh told them his dreams: but none could interpret them to Pharaoh.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then spake the chief butler unto Pharaoh, saying, I call to mind my faults this day.
speaker: Narrator

text: Pharaoh being angry with his servants, put me in ward in the chief steward’s house, both me, and the chief baker.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then we dreamed a dream in one night both I, and he: we dreamed each man according to the interpretation of his dream.
speaker: Narrator

text: And there was with us a young man, an Hebrew, servant unto the chief steward, whom when we told, he declared our dreams to us, to everyone he declared according to his dream.
speaker: Narrator

text: And as he declared unto us, so it came to pass: for he restored me to mine office, and hanged him.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then sent Pharaoh, and called Joseph and they brought him hastily out of prison, and he shaved him, and changed his raiment, and came to Pharaoh.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Pharaoh said to Joseph, I have dreamed a dream, and no man can interpret it, and I have heard say of thee, that when thou hearest a dream, thou canst interpret it.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Joseph answered Pharaoh, saying, Without me God shall answer for the wealth of Pharaoh.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Pharaoh said unto Joseph: In my dream, behold, I stood by the bank of the river:
speaker: Narrator

text: And lo, there came up out of the river seven fat fleshed, and well favored kine. and they fed in the meadow.
speaker: Narrator

text: Also lo, seven other kine came up after them poor and very evil favored kine, and lean fleshed: I never saw the like in all the land of Egypt, for evil favored.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the lean and the evil favored kine did eat up the first seven fat kine.
speaker: Narrator

text: And when they had eaten them up: it could not be known that they had eaten them, but they were still as evil favored, as they were at the beginning: so did I awake.
speaker: Narrator

text: Moreover I saw in my dream, and behold, seven ears sprang out of one stalk, full and fair.
speaker: Narrator

text: And lo, seven ears withered, thin, and blasted with the East wind, sprang up after them.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the thin ears devoured the seven good ears. Now I have told the soothsayers, and none can declare it unto me.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Joseph answered Pharaoh, Both Pharaoh’s dreams are one. God hath showed Pharaoh what he is about to do.
speaker: Narrator

text: The seven good Kine are seven years, and the seven good ears are seven years: this is one dream.
speaker: Narrator

text: Likewise the seven thin and evil favored kine, that came out after them, are seven years: and the seven empty ears blasted with the East wind, are seven years of famine.
speaker: Narrator

text: This is the thing which I have said unto Pharaoh, that God hath showed unto Pharaoh, what he is about to do.
speaker: Narrator

text: Behold, there come seven years of great plenty in all the land of Egypt.
speaker: Narrator

text: Again, there shall arise after them seven years of famine, so that all the plenty shall be forgotten in the land of Egypt, and the famine shall consume the land:
speaker: Narrator

text: Neither shall the plenty be known in the land, by reason of this famine that shall come after, for it shall be exceeding great.
speaker: Narrator

text: And therefore the dream was doubled unto Pharaoh the second time, because the thing is established by God, and God hasteth to perform it.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now therefore let Pharaoh provide for a man of understanding and wisdom, and set him over the land of Egypt.
speaker: Narrator

text: Let Pharaoh make and appoint officers over the land, and take up the fifth part of the land of Egypt in the seven plenteous years.
speaker: Narrator

text: Also let them gather all the food of these good years that come, and lay up corn under the hand of Pharaoh for food, in the cities, and let them keep it.
speaker: Narrator

text: So the food shall be for the provision of the land, against the seven years of famine, which shall be in the land of Egypt, that the land perish not by famine.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the saying pleased Pharaoh and all his servants.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then said Pharaoh unto his servants, Can we find such a man as this, in whom is the Spirit of God?
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Pharaoh said to Joseph, Forasmuch as God hath showed thee all this, there is no man of understanding, or wisdom like unto thee.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thou shalt be over mine house, and at thy word shall all my people be armed, only in the king’s throne will I be above thee.
speaker: Narrator

text: Moreover Pharaoh said to Joseph, Behold, I have set thee over all the land of Egypt.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Pharaoh took off his ring from his hand, and put it upon Joseph’s hand, and arrayed him in garments of fine linen, and put a golden chain about his neck.
speaker: Narrator

text: So he sat him upon the best chariot that he had, save one: and they cried before him, Abrech, and placed him over all the land of Egypt.
speaker: Narrator

text: Again Pharaoh said unto Joseph, I am Pharaoh, and without thee shall no man lift up his hand or his foot in the land of Egypt.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Pharaoh called Joseph’s name Zaphnath-Paaneah: and he gave him to wife Asenath the daughter of Poti-Pherah Prince of On: then went Joseph abroad in the land of Egypt.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Joseph was thirty years old when he stood before Pharaoh King of Egypt: and Joseph departing from the presence of Pharaoh, went throughout all the land of Egypt.
speaker: Narrator

text: And in the seven plenteous years the earth brought forth store.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he gathered up all the food of the seven plenteous years, which were in the land of Egypt, and laid up the food in the cities: the food of the field, that was round about every city, laid he up in the same.
speaker: Narrator

text: So Joseph gathered wheat, like unto the sand of the sea in multitude out of measure, until he left numbering: for it was without number.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now unto Joseph were born two sons (before the year of famine came) which Asenath the daughter of Poti-Pherah prince of On bare unto him.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Joseph called the name of the firstborn Manasseh: for God, said he, hath made me forget all my labor and all my father’s household.
speaker: Narrator

text: Also he called the name of the second, Ephraim: For God, said he, hath made me fruitful in the land of my affliction.
speaker: Narrator

text: So the seven years of the plenty that was in the land of Egypt were ended.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then began the seven years of famine to come, according as Joseph had said: and the famine was in all lands, but in all the land of Egypt was bread.
speaker: Narrator

text: At the length all the land of Egypt was famished, and the people cried unto Pharaoh for bread. And Pharaoh said unto all the Egyptians, Go to Joseph: what he saith to you, do ye.
speaker: Narrator

text: When the famine was upon all the land, Joseph opened all places, wherein the store was, and sold unto the Egyptians: for the famine waxed sore in the land of Egypt.
speaker: Narrator

text: And all the countries came to Egypt to buy corn of Joseph, because the famine was sore in all lands.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Jacob saw that there was food in Egypt, and Jacob said unto his sons, Why gaze ye one upon another?
speaker: Narrator

text: And he said, Behold, I have heard that there is food in Egypt, Get you down thither, and buy us food thence, that we may live and not die.
speaker: Narrator

text: So went Joseph’s ten brethren down to buy corn of the Egyptians.
speaker: Narrator

text: But Benjamin Joseph’s brother, would not Jacob send with his brethren: for he said, Lest death should befall him.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the sons of Israel came to buy food among them that came: for there was famine in the land of Canaan.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now Joseph was governor of the land, who sold to all the people of the land: then Joseph’s brethren came, and bowed their faces to the ground before him.
speaker: Narrator

text: And when Joseph saw his brethren, he knew them, and made himself strange toward them, and spake to them roughly, and said unto them, Whence come ye? Who answered, Out of the land of Canaan, to buy vittles.
speaker: Narrator

text: (Now Joseph knew his brethren, but they knew not him.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Joseph remembered the dreams, which he dreamed of them) and he said unto them, Ye are spies, and are come to see the weakness of the land.
speaker: Narrator

text: But they said unto him, Nay, my lord, but to buy vittles thy servants are come.
speaker: Narrator

text: We are all one man’s sons: we mean truly, and thy servants are no spies.
speaker: Narrator

text: But he said unto them, Nay, but ye are come to see the weakness of the land.
speaker: Narrator

text: And they said, We thy servants, are twelve brethren, the sons of one man in the land of Canaan: and behold, the youngest is this day with our father, and one is not.
speaker: Narrator

text: Again Joseph said unto them, This is it that I spake unto you, saying, Ye are spies.
speaker: Narrator

text: Hereby ye shall be proved: by the life of Pharaoh, ye shall not go hence, except your youngest brother come hither.
speaker: Narrator

text: Send one of you which may fetch your brother, and ye shall be kept in prison, that your words may be proved, whether there be truth in you, or else by the life of Pharaoh ye are but spies.
speaker: Narrator

text: So he put them in ward three days.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Joseph said unto them the third day, This do, and live: for I fear God.
speaker: Narrator

text: If ye be true men, let one of your brethren be bound in your prison house, and go ye, carry food for the famine of your houses:
speaker: Narrator

text: But bring your younger brother unto me, that your words may be tried, and that ye die not: and they did so.
speaker: Narrator

text: And they said one to another, We have verily sinned against our brother, in that we saw the anguish of his soul, when he besought us, and we would not hear him: therefore is this trouble come upon us.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Reuben answered them, saying, Warned I not you, saying, Sin not against the child, and ye would not hear? and lo, his blood is now required.
speaker: Narrator

text: (And they were not aware that Joseph understood them: for he spake unto them by an interpreter.)
speaker: Narrator

text: Then he turned from them, and wept, and turned to them again, and communed with them, and took Simeon from among them, and bound him before their eyes.
speaker: Narrator

text: So Joseph commanded that they should fill their sacks with wheat, and put every man’s money again in his sack, and give them vittles for the journey: and thus did he unto them.
speaker: Narrator

text: And they laid their vittles upon their asses, and departed thence.
speaker: Narrator

text: And as one of them opened his sack for to give his ass provender in the Inn, he espied his money: for lo, it was in his sack’s mouth.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then he said unto his brethren, My money is restored: for lo, it is even in my sack. And their heart failed them, and they were astonished, and said one to another, What is this, that God hath done unto us?
speaker: Narrator

text: And they came unto Jacob their father unto the land of Canaan, and told him all that had befallen them, saying,
speaker: Narrator

text: The man who is lord of the land, spake roughly to us, and put us in prison as spies of the country.
speaker: Narrator

text: And we said unto him, We are true men, and are no spies.
speaker: Narrator

text: We be twelve brethren, sons of our father: one is not, and the youngest is this day with our father in the land of Canaan.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then the lord of the country said unto us, Hereby shall I know if ye be true men: Leave one of your brethren with me, and take food for the famine of your houses, and depart,
speaker: Narrator

text: And bring your youngest brother unto me, that I may know that ye are no spies, but true men: so will I deliver you your brother, and ye shall occupy in the land.
speaker: Narrator

text: And as they emptied their sacks, behold, every man’s bundle of money was in his sack: and when they and their father saw the bundles of their money, they were afraid.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Jacob their father said to them, Ye have robbed me of my children: Joseph is not, and Simeon is not, and ye will take Benjamin: all these things are against me.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Reuben answered his father, saying, Slay my two sons, if I bring him not to thee again: deliver him to mine hand, and I will bring him to thee again.
speaker: Narrator

text: But he said, My son shall not go down with you: for his brother is dead, and he is left alone: if death come unto him by the way which ye go, then ye shall bring my gray head with sorrow unto the grave.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now great famine was in the land.
speaker: Narrator

text: And when they had eaten up the vittles, which they had brought from Egypt, their father said unto them, Turn again and buy us a little food.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Judah answered him, saying, The man charged us by an oath, saying, Never see my face, except your brother be with you.
speaker: Narrator

text: If thou wilt send our brother with us, we will go down, and buy thee food.
speaker: Narrator

text: But if thou wilt not send him, we will not go down: for the man said unto us, Look me not in the face, except your brother be with you.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Israel said, Wherefore dealt ye so evil with me, as to tell the man, whether ye had yet a brother or no?
speaker: Narrator

text: And they answered, The man asked straightly of ourselves and of our kindred, saying, Is your father yet alive? have ye any brother? And we told him according to these words: could we know certainly that he would say, Bring your brother down?
speaker: Narrator

text: Then said Judah to Israel his father, Send the boy with me, that we may rise and go, and that we may live, and not die, both we, and thou, and our children.
speaker: Narrator

text: I will be surety for him: of mine hand shalt thou require him. If I bring him not to thee, and set him before thee, then let me bear the blame forever.
speaker: Narrator

text: For except we had made this tarrying, doubtless by this we had returned the second time.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then their father Israel said unto them, If it must needs be so now, do thus: take of the best fruits of the land in your vessels, and bring the man a present, a little rosin, and a little honey, spices and myrrh, nuts, and almonds:
speaker: Narrator

text: And take double money in your hand, and the money, that was brought again in your sacks’ mouths carry it again in your hand, lest it were some oversight.
speaker: Narrator

text: Take also your brother and arise, and go again to the man.
speaker: Narrator

text: And God Almighty give you mercy in the sight of the man, that he may deliver you your other brother, and Benjamin: but I shall be robbed of my child, as I have been.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thus the men took this present, and took twice so much money in their hand with Benjamin, and rose up, and went down to Egypt, and stood before Joseph.
speaker: Narrator

text: And when Joseph saw Benjamin with them, he said to his steward, Bring these men home and kill meat, and make ready: for the men shall eat with me at noon.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the men did as Joseph bade, and brought the men unto Joseph’s house.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now when the men were brought into Joseph’s house, they were afraid, and said, Because of the money, that came in our sack’s mouths at the first time, are we brought, that he may pick a quarrel against us, and lay something to our charge, and bring us in bondage and our asses.
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore came they to Joseph’s steward, and communed with him at the door of his house,
speaker: Narrator

text: And said, O sir, we came indeed down hither at the first time to buy food,
speaker: Narrator

text: And as we came to an Inn and opened our sacks, behold, every man’s money was in his sack’s mouth, even our money in full weight, but we have brought it in our hands.
speaker: Narrator

text: Also other money have we brought in our hands to buy food, but we cannot tell, who put our money in our sacks.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he said, Peace be to you, fear not: your God, and the God of your father hath given you that treasure in your sacks, I had your money: and he brought forth Simeon to them.
speaker: Narrator

text: So the man led them into Joseph’s house, and gave them water to wash their feet, and gave their asses provender.
speaker: Narrator

text: And they made ready their present against Joseph came at noon, (for they heard say, that they should eat bread there.)
speaker: Narrator

text: When Joseph came home, they brought the present into the house to him, which was in their hands, and bowed down to the ground before him.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he asked them of their prosperity, and said, Is your father the old man, of whom ye told me, in good health? is he yet alive?
speaker: Narrator

text: Who answered, Thy servant our father is in good health, he is yet alive: and they bowed down, and made obeisance.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he lifting up his eyes, beheld his brother Benjamin, his mother’s son, and said, Is this your younger brother of whom ye told me? And he said, God be merciful unto thee, my son.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Joseph made haste (for his affection was inflamed toward his brother, and sought where to weep) and entered into his chamber and wept there.
speaker: Narrator

text: Afterward he washed his face, and came out, and refrained himself, and said, Set on meat.
speaker: Narrator

text: And they prepared for him by himself, and for them by themselves, and for the Egyptians, which did eat with him, by themselves, because the Egyptians might not eat bread with the Hebrews: for that was an abomination unto the Egyptians.
speaker: Narrator

text: So they sat before him: the eldest according unto his age, and the youngest according unto his youth: and the men marveled among themselves.
speaker: Narrator

text: And they took meats from before him, and sent to them: but Benjamin’s meat was five times so much as any of theirs: and they drank, and had of the best drink with him.
speaker: Narrator

text: Afterward he commanded his steward, saying, Fill the men’s sacks with food, as much as they can carry, and put every man’s money in his sack’s mouth.
speaker: Narrator

text: And put my cup, I mean, the silver cup, in the sack’s mouth of the youngest, and his corn money. And he did according to the commandment that Joseph gave him.
speaker: Narrator

text: And in the morning the men were sent away, they, and their asses.
speaker: Narrator

text: And when they went out of the city not far off, Joseph said to his steward, Up, follow after the men: and when thou dost overtake them, say unto them, Wherefore have ye rewarded evil for good?
speaker: Narrator

text: Is not that the cup wherein my lord drinketh? and in the which he doth divine and prophesy? ye have done evil in so doing.
speaker: Narrator

text: And when he overtook them, he said these words unto them.
speaker: Narrator

text: And they answered him, Wherefore saith my lord such words? God forbid that thy servants should do such a thing.
speaker: Narrator

text: Behold, the money which we found in our sacks’ mouths, we brought again unto thee out of the land of Canaan: how then should we steal out of thy lord’s house silver or gold?
speaker: Narrator

text: With whomsoever of thy servants it be found, let him die, and we also will be my lord’s bondmen.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he said, Now then let it be according unto your words: he with whom it is found, shall be my servant, and ye shall be blameless.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then at once every man took down his sack to the ground, and everyone opened his sack.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he searched, and began at the eldest, and left at the youngest: and the cup was found in Benjamin’s sack.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then they rent their clothes, and laded every man his ass, and went again into the city.
speaker: Narrator

text: So Judah and his brethren came to Joseph’s house (for he was yet there) and they fell before him on the ground.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Joseph said unto them, What act is this, which ye have done? know ye not that such a man as I, can divine and prophesy?
speaker: Narrator

text: Then said Judah, What shall we say unto my lord? what shall we speak? and how can we justify ourselves? God hath found out the wickedness of thy servants: behold, we are servants to my lord, both we, and he, with whom the cup is found.
speaker: Narrator

text: But he answered, God forbid, that I should do so, but the man, with whom the cup is found, he shall be my servant, and go ye in peace unto your father.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Judah drew near unto him, and said, Oh my lord, let thy servant now speak a word in my lord’s ears, and let not thy wrath be kindled against thy servant: for thou art even as Pharaoh.
speaker: Narrator

text: My lord asked his servants, saying, Have ye a father, or a brother?
speaker: Narrator

text: And we answered my lord, We have a father that is old, and a young child, which he begat in his age: and his brother is dead, and he alone is left of his mother, and his father loveth him.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now thou saidest unto thy servants, Bring him unto me, that I may set mine eye upon him.
speaker: Narrator

text: And we answered my lord, The child cannot depart his father: for if he leave his father, his father would die.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then saidest thou unto thy servants, Except your younger brother come down with you, look in my face no more.
speaker: Narrator

text: So when we came unto thy servant our father, and showed him what my lord had said,
speaker: Narrator

text: And our father said unto us, Go again, buy us a little food.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then we answered, We cannot go down, but if our youngest brother go with us, then will we go down: for we may not see the man’s face, except our youngest brother be with us.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then thy servant my father said unto us, Ye know that my wife bare me two sons.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the one went out from me, and I said, Of a surety he is torn in pieces, and I saw him not since.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now ye take this also away from me: if death take him, then ye shall bring my gray head in sorrow to the grave.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now therefore, when I come to thy servant my father, and the child be not with us (seeing that his life dependeth on the child’s life.)
speaker: Narrator

text: Then when he shall see that the child is not come, he will die: so shall thy servants bring down the gray head of thy servant our father with sorrow to the grave.
speaker: Narrator

text: Doubtless thy servant became surety for the child to my father, and, If I bring him not unto thee again, then I will bear the blame unto my father forever.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now therefore, I pray thee, let me thy servant abide for the child, as a servant to my lord, and let the child go up with his brethren.
speaker: Narrator

text: For how can I go up to my father: if the child be not with me, unless I would see the evil that shall come on my father.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Joseph could not refrain himself before all that stood by him, but he cried, Have forth every man from me. And there tarried not one with him, while Joseph uttered himself unto his brethren.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he wept, and cried, so that the Egyptians heard: the house of Pharaoh heard also.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Joseph said unto his brethren, I am Joseph: doth my father yet live? But his brethren could not answer him, for they were astonished at his presence.
speaker: Narrator

text: Again, Joseph said to his brethren, Come near, I pray you, to me. And they came near. And he said, I am Joseph your brother, whom ye sold into Egypt.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now therefore be not sad, neither grieved with yourselves, that ye sold me hither: For God did send me before you for your preservation.
speaker: Narrator

text: For now two years of famine have been through the land, and five years are behind, wherein neither shall be earing nor harvest.
speaker: Narrator

text: Wherefore God sent me before you to preserve your posterity in this land, and to save you alive by a great deliverance.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now then you sent not me hither, but God, who hath made me a father unto Pharaoh, and lord of all his house, and ruler throughout all the land of Egypt.
speaker: Narrator

text: Haste you and go up to my father, and tell him, Thus saith thy son Joseph, God hath made me lord of all Egypt: come down to me, tarry not.
speaker: Narrator

text: And thou shalt dwell in the land of Goshen, and shalt be near me, thou and thy children, and thy children’s children, and thy sheep, and thy beasts, and all that thou hast.
speaker: Narrator

text: Also I will nourish thee there (for yet remain five years of famine) lest thou perish through poverty, thou and thy household, and all that thou hast.
speaker: Narrator

text: And behold, your eyes do see, and the eyes of my brother Benjamin, that my mouth speaketh to you.
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore tell my father of all mine honor in Egypt, and of all that ye have seen, and make haste, and bring my father hither.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then he fell on his brother Benjamin’s neck, and wept, and Benjamin wept on his neck.
speaker: Narrator

text: Moreover, he kissed all his brethren, and wept upon them: and afterward his brethren talked with him.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the tidings came to Pharaoh’s house, so that they said, Joseph’s brethren are come: and it pleased Pharaoh well, and his servants.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Pharaoh said to Joseph, Say to thy brethren, This do ye, laid your beasts and depart, go to the land of Canaan,
speaker: Narrator

text: And take your father, and your household, and come to me, and I will give you the best of the land of Egypt, and ye shall eat of the fat of the land.
speaker: Narrator

text: And I command thee, Thus do ye, take you chariots out of the land of Egypt for your children, and for your wives, and bring your father and come.
speaker: Narrator

text: Also regard not your stuff: for the best of all the land of Egypt is yours.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the children of Israel did so: and Joseph gave them chariots according to the commandment of Pharaoh: he gave them vittles also for the journey.
speaker: Narrator

text: He gave them all, none except, change of raiment: but unto Benjamin he gave three hundred pieces of silver, and five suits of raiment.
speaker: Narrator

text: And unto his father likewise he sent ten he asses laden with the best things of Egypt, and ten she asses laden with wheat, and bread and meat for his father by the way.
speaker: Narrator

text: So sent he his brethren away, and they departed: and he said unto them, Fall not out by the way.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then they went up from Egypt, and came unto the land of Canaan, unto Jacob their father,
speaker: Narrator

text: And told him, saying, Joseph is yet alive, and he also is governor over all the land of Egypt, and Jacob’s heart failed: for he believed them not.
speaker: Narrator

text: And they told him all the words of Joseph, which he had said unto them: but when he saw the chariots, which Joseph had sent to carry him, then the spirit of Jacob their father revived.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Israel said, I have enough: Joseph my son is yet alive: I will go and see him yet I die.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Israel took his journey with all that he had, and came to Beersheba, and offered sacrifice unto the God of his father Isaac.
speaker: Narrator

text: And God spake unto Israel in a vision by night, saying, Jacob, Jacob. Who answered, I am here.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then he said, I am God, the God of thy father, fear not to go down into Egypt: for I will there make of thee a great nation.
speaker: Narrator

text: I will go down with thee into Egypt, and I will also bring thee up again, and Joseph shall put his hand upon thine eyes.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Jacob rose up from Beersheba: and the sons of Israel carried Jacob their father, and their children, and their wives in the chariots, which Pharaoh had sent to carry him.
speaker: Narrator

text: And they took their cattle, and their goods, which they had gotten in the land of Canaan, and came into Egypt, both Jacob and all his seed with him.
speaker: Narrator

text: His sons and his sons’ sons with him, his daughters, and his sons’ daughters, and all his seed brought he with him into Egypt.
speaker: Narrator

text: And these are the names of the children of Israel, which came into Egypt, even Jacob and his sons: Reuben, Jacob’s firstborn.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the sons of Reuben: Hanoch, and Pallu, and Hezron, and Carmi.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the sons of Simeon: Jemuel, and Jamin, and Ohad, and Jachin, and Zohar, and Shaul the son of a Canaanitish woman.
speaker: Narrator

text: Also the sons of Levi: Gershon, Kohath, and Merari.
speaker: Narrator

text: Also the sons of Judah: Er, and Onan, and Shelah, and Perez, and Zerah: (but Er and Onan died in the land of Canaan.) And the sons of Perez were Hezron and Hamul.
speaker: Narrator

text: Also the sons of Issachar: Tola, and Puvah, and Job, and Shimron.
speaker: Narrator

text: Also the sons of Zebulun: Sered, and Elon, and Jahleel.
speaker: Narrator

text: These be the sons of Leah, which she bare unto Jacob in Padan Aram, with his daughter Dinah. All the souls of his sons and his daughters were thirty and three.
speaker: Narrator

text: Also the sons of Gad: Ziphion, and Haggi, Shuni, and Ezbon, Eri, and Arodi, and Areli.
speaker: Narrator

text: Also the sons of Asher: Jimnah, and Ishuah, and Isui, and Beriah, and Serah their sister. And the sons of Beriah: and Heber, Malchiel.
speaker: Narrator

text: These are the children of Zilpah, whom Laban gave to Leah his daughter: and these she bare unto Jacob, even sixteen souls.
speaker: Narrator

text: The sons of Rachel Jacob’s wife were Joseph, and Benjamin.
speaker: Narrator

text: And unto Joseph in the land of Egypt were born Manasseh, and Ephraim, which Asenath the daughter of Poti-Pherah prince of On bare unto him.
speaker: Narrator

text: Also the sons of Benjamin: Belah, and Becher, and Ashbel, and Gera, Naaman, Ehi, and Rosh, Muppim, and Huppim, and Ard.
speaker: Narrator

text: These are the sons of Rachel, which were born unto Jacob, fourteen souls in all.
speaker: Narrator

text: Also the sons of Dan: Hushim.
speaker: Narrator

text: Also the sons of Naphtali: Jahzeel, and Guni, and Jezer, and Shillem.
speaker: Narrator

text: These are the sons of Bilhah, which Laban gave unto Rachel his daughter, and she bare these unto Jacob, in all seven souls.
speaker: Narrator

text: All the souls, that came with Jacob into Egypt, which came out of his loins (besides Jacob’s sons’ wives) were in the whole, threescore and six souls.
speaker: Narrator

text: Also the sons of Joseph, which were born him in Egypt, were two souls: so that all the souls of the house of Jacob, which came into Egypt, are seventy.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then he sent Judah before him unto Joseph, to direct his way unto Goshen, and they came into the land of Goshen.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Joseph made ready his chariot, and went up to Goshen to meet Israel his father, and presented himself unto him, and fell on his neck and wept upon his neck a good while.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Israel said unto Joseph, Now let me die since I have seen thy face, and that thou art yet alive.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Joseph said to his brethren, and to his father’s house, I will go up and show Pharaoh, and tell him, My brethren and my father’s house, which were in the land of Canaan, are come unto me.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the men are sheepherders, and because they are sheepherders, they have brought their sheep and their cattle, and all that they have.
speaker: Narrator

text: And if Pharaoh call you, and ask you, What is your trade?
speaker: Narrator

text: That ye shall say, Thy servants are men occupied about cattle, from our childhood even unto this time, both we and our fathers: that ye may dwell in the land of Goshen: for every sheep keeper is an abomination unto the Egyptians.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then came Joseph and told Pharaoh, and said, My father, and my brethren, and their sheep, and their cattle, and all that they have, are come out of the land of Canaan, and behold, they are in the land of Goshen.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Joseph took part of his brethren, even five men, and presented them unto Pharaoh.
speaker: Narrator

text: When Pharaoh said unto his brethren, What is your trade? And they answered Pharaoh, Thy servants are shepherds, both we and our fathers.
speaker: Narrator

text: They said moreover unto Pharaoh, For to sojourn in the land are we come: for thy servants have no pasture for their sheep, so sore is the famine in the land of Canaan, Now therefore, we pray thee: let thy servants dwell in the land of Goshen.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then spake Pharaoh to Joseph, saying, Thy father and thy brethren are come unto thee.
speaker: Narrator

text: The land of Egypt is before thee: in the best place of the land make thy father and thy brethren to dwell: let them dwell in the land of Goshen: and if thou knowest that there be men of activity among them, make them rulers over my cattle.
speaker: Narrator

text: Joseph also brought Jacob his father, and set him before Pharaoh. And Jacob saluted Pharaoh.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Pharaoh said unto Jacob, How old art thou?
speaker: Narrator

text: And Jacob said unto Pharaoh, The whole time of my pilgrimage is an hundred and thirty years: few and evil have the days of my life been, and I have not attained unto the years of the life of my fathers, in the days of their pilgrimages.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Jacob took leave of Pharaoh, and departed from the presence of Pharaoh.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Joseph placed his father, and his brethren, and gave them possession in the land of Egypt, in the best of the land, even in the land of Rameses, as Pharaoh had commanded.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Joseph nourished his father, and his brethren, and all his father’s household with bread even to the young children.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now there was no bread in all the land; for the famine was exceeding sore: so that the land of Egypt, and the land of Canaan were famished by reason of the famine.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Joseph gathered all the money, that was found in the land of Egypt, and in the land of Canaan, for the corn which they bought, and Joseph laid up the money in Pharaoh’s house.
speaker: Narrator

text: So when money failed in the land of Egypt, and in the land of Canaan, then all the Egyptians came unto Joseph and said, Give us bread: for why should we die before thee? for our money is spent.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then said Joseph, Bring your cattle, and I will give you for your cattle, if your money be spent.
speaker: Narrator

text: So they brought their cattle unto Joseph, and Joseph gave them bread for the horses, and for the flocks of sheep, and for the herds of cattle, and for the asses: so he fed them with bread for all their cattle that year.
speaker: Narrator

text: But when the year was ended, they came unto him the second year, and said unto him, We will not hide from my lord, that since our money is spent, and my lord hath the herds of the cattle, there is nothing left in the sight of my lord, but our bodies and our ground.
speaker: Narrator

text: Why shall we perish in thy sight, both we and our land? buy us and our land for bread, and we and our land will be bound to Pharaoh: therefore give us seed, that we may live and not die, and that the land go not to waste.
speaker: Narrator

text: So Joseph bought all the land of Egypt for Pharaoh: for the Egyptians sold every man his ground, because the famine was sore upon them: so the land became Pharaoh’s.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he removed the people unto the cities, from one side of Egypt even to the other.
speaker: Narrator

text: Only the land of the Priests bought he not: for the Priests had an ordinary of Pharaoh, and they did eat their ordinary, which Pharaoh gave them: wherefore they sold not their ground.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Joseph said unto the people, Behold, I have bought you this day, and your land for Pharaoh: lo, here is seed for you: sow therefore the ground.
speaker: Narrator

text: And of the increase ye shall give the fifth part unto Pharaoh, and four parts shall be yours for seed of the field, and for your meat, and for them of your households, and for your children to eat.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then they answered, Thou hast saved our lives: let us find grace in the sight of my lord, and we will be Pharaoh’s servants.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Joseph made it a law over the land of Egypt unto this day, that Pharaoh should have the fifth part, except the land of the Priests only, which was not Pharaoh’s.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Israel dwelt in the land of Egypt, in the country of Goshen: and they had their possessions therein, and grew and multiplied exceedingly.
speaker: Narrator

text: Moreover, Jacob lived in the land of Egypt seventeen years, so the whole age of Jacob was an hundred forty and seven years.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now when the time drew near that Israel must die, he called his son Joseph, and said unto him, If I have now found grace in thy sight, put thine hand now under my thigh, and deal mercifully and truly with me: bury me not, I pray thee, in Egypt.
speaker: Narrator

text: But when I shall sleep with my fathers, thou shalt carry me out of Egypt, and bury me in their burial. And he answered, I will do as thou hast said.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then he said, swear unto me. And he sware unto him. And Israel worshipped towards the bed’s head.
speaker: Narrator

text: Again after this, one said to Joseph, Lo, thy father is sick: then he took with him his two sons, Manasseh and Ephraim.
speaker: Narrator

text: Also one told Jacob, and said, Behold thy son Joseph is come to thee, and Israel took his strength unto him and sat upon the bed.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Jacob said unto Joseph, God almighty appeared unto me at Luz in the land of Canaan, and blessed me,
speaker: Narrator

text: And said unto me, Behold, I will make thee fruitful, and will multiply thee, and will make a great number of people of thee, and will give this land unto thy seed after thee for an everlasting possession.
speaker: Narrator

text: And now thy two sons, Manasseh and Ephraim, which are born unto thee in the land of Egypt before I came to thee into Egypt, shall be mine, as Reuben and Simeon are mine.
speaker: Narrator

text: But thy lineage, which thou hast begotten after them, shall be thine: they shall be called after the names of their brethren in their inheritance.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now when I came from Padan, Rachel died upon mine hand in the land of Canaan, by the way when there was but half a day’s journey of ground to come to Ephrath: and I buried her there in the way to Ephrath: the same is Bethlehem.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Israel beheld Joseph’s sons and said, Whose are these?
speaker: Narrator

text: And Joseph said unto his father, They are my sons, which God hath given me here. Then he said, I pray thee, bring them to me, that I may bless them:
speaker: Narrator

text: ( For the eyes of Israel were dim for age, so that he could not well see) Then he caused them to come to him, and he kissed them and embraced them.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Israel said unto Joseph, I had not thought to have seen thy face: yet lo, God hath showed me also thy seed.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Joseph took them away from his knees, and did reverence down to the ground.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then took Joseph them both, Ephraim in his right hand toward Israel’s left hand, and Manasseh in his left hand toward Israel’s right hand, so he brought them unto him.
speaker: Narrator

text: But Israel stretched out his right hand, and laid it on Ephraim’s head which was the younger, and his left hand upon Manasseh’s head (directing his hands of purpose) for Manasseh was the elder.
speaker: Narrator

text: Also he blesseth Joseph, and said, The God, before whom my fathers, Abraham and Isaac did walk, the God which hath fed me all my life long, unto this day, bless thee.
speaker: Narrator

text: The Angel, which hath delivered me from all evil, bless the children, and let my name be named upon them, and the name of my fathers Abraham and Isaac, that they may grow as fish into a multitude in the midst of the earth.
speaker: Narrator

text: But when Joseph saw that his father laid his right hand upon the head of Ephraim, it displeased him: and he stayed his father’s hand to remove it from Ephraim’s head to Manasseh’s head.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Joseph said unto his father, Not so, my father: for this is the eldest: put thy right hand upon his head.
speaker: Narrator

text: But his father refused, and said, I know well, my son, I know well: he shall be also a people, and he shall be great likewise: but his younger brother shall be greater than he, and his seed shall be full of nations.
speaker: Narrator

text: So he blessed them that day, and said, In thee Israel shall bless, and say, God make thee as Ephraim and as Manasseh, and he set Ephraim before Manasseh.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Israel said unto Joseph, Behold, I die, and God shall be with you, and bring you again unto the land of your fathers.
speaker: Narrator

text: Moreover, I have given unto thee one portion above thy brethren, which I got out of the hand of the Amorite by my sword and by my bow.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Jacob called his sons, and said, Gather yourselves together, that I may tell you what shall come to you in the last days.
speaker: Narrator

text: Gather yourselves together, and hear, ye sons of Jacob, and hearken unto Israel your father.
speaker: Narrator

text: Reuben mine eldest son, thou art my might, and the beginning of my strength, the excellency of dignity, and the excellency of power:
speaker: Narrator

text: Thou wast light as water: thou shalt not be excellent, because thou wentest up to thy father’s bed: then diddest thou defile my bed, thy dignity is gone.
speaker: Narrator

text: Simeon and Levi, brethren in evil, the instruments of cruelty are in their habitations.
speaker: Narrator

text: Into their secret let not my soul come: my glory be not thou joined with their assembly: for in their wrath they slew a man, and in their self-will they dug down a wall.
speaker: Narrator

text: Cursed be their wrath, for it was fierce, and their rage, for it was cruel: I will divide them in Jacob, and scatter them in Israel.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thou Judah, thy brethren shall praise thee: thy hand shall be in the neck of thine enemies: thy father’s son shall bow down before unto thee.
speaker: Narrator

text: Judah as a Lion’s whelp shalt thou come up from the spoil, my son. He shall lie down and couch a Lion, and as a Lioness: Who shall stir him up?
speaker: Narrator

text: The Sceptre shall not depart from Judah, nor a Lawgiver from between his feet, until Shiloh come, and the people shall be gathered unto him.
speaker: Narrator

text: He shall bind his Ass foal unto the vine, and his ass’s colt unto the best vine. He shall wash his garment in wine, and his cloak in the blood of grapes.
speaker: Narrator

text: His eyes shall be red with wine, and his teeth white with milk.
speaker: Narrator

text: Zebulun shall dwell by the seaside, and he shall be an haven for ships: and his border shall be unto Sidon.
speaker: Narrator

text: Issachar shall be a strong ass, couching down between two burdens:
speaker: Narrator

text: And he shall see that rest is good, and that the land is pleasant, and he shall bow his shoulder to bear, and shall be subject unto tribute.
speaker: Narrator

text: Dan shall judge his people as one of the tribes of Israel.
speaker: Narrator

text: Dan shall be a serpent by the way, an adder by the path, biting the horse heels, so that his rider shall fall backward.
speaker: Narrator

text: O Lord, I have waited for thy salvation.
speaker: Narrator

text: Gad, a host of men shall overcome him, but he shall overcome at the last.
speaker: Narrator

text: Concerning Asher, his bread shall be fat, and he shall give pleasures for a king.
speaker: Narrator

text: Naphtali shall be a hind let go, giving goodly words.
speaker: Narrator

text: Joseph shall be a fruitful bough, even a fruitful bough by the well side: the small boughs shall turn upon the wall:
speaker: Narrator

text: And the archers grieved him, and shot against him, and hated him.
speaker: Narrator

text: But his bow abode strong, and the hands of his arms were strengthened, by the hands of the mighty God of Jacob, of whom was the feeder appointed by the stone of Israel,
speaker: Narrator

text: Even by the God of thy father, who shall help thee, and by the almighty, who shall bless thee with heavenly blessings from above, with blessings of the deep that lieth beneath, with blessings of the breasts, and of the womb.
speaker: Narrator

text: The blessings of thy father shall be stronger than the blessings of mine elders: unto the end of the hills of the world they shall be on the head of Joseph, and on the top of the head of him that was separated from his brethren.
speaker: Narrator

text: Benjamin shall raven as a wolf: in the morning he shall devour the prey, and at night he shall divide the spoil.
speaker: Narrator

text: All these are the twelve tribes of Israel, and thus their father spake unto them, and blessed them: every one of them blessed he with a several blessing.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he charged them and said unto them, I am ready to be gathered unto my people: bury me with my fathers in the cave, that is in the field of Ephron the Hittite,
speaker: Narrator

text: In the cave that is in the field of Machpelah, besides Mamre in the land of Canaan: which cave Abraham bought with the field of Ephron the Hittite for a possession to bury in.
speaker: Narrator

text: There they buried Abraham and Sarah his wife: there they buried Isaac and Rebekah his wife: and there I buried Leah.
speaker: Narrator

text: The purchase of the field and the cave that is therein, was bought of the children of Heth.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thus Jacob made an end of giving charge to his sons, and plucked his feet into the bed, and gave up the ghost, and was gathered to his people.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Joseph fell upon his father’s face and wept upon him, and kissed him.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Joseph commanded his servants the physicians to embalm his father, and the physicians embalmed Israel.
speaker: Narrator

text: So forty days were accomplished (for so long did the days of them that were embalmed last) and the Egyptians bewailed him seventy days.
speaker: Narrator

text: And when the days of his mourning were past, Joseph spake to the house of Pharaoh, saying, If I have now found favor in your eyes, speak, I pray you, in the ears, of Pharaoh, and say,
speaker: Narrator

text: My father made me swear saying, Lo, I die, bury me in my grave, which I have made me in the land of Canaan: now therefore let me go, I pray thee, and bury my father, and I will come again.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Pharaoh said, Go up and bury thy father, as he made thee to swear.
speaker: Narrator

text: So Joseph went up to bury his father, and with him went all the servants of Pharaoh, both the elders of his house, and all the elders of the land of Egypt,
speaker: Narrator

text: Likewise all the house of Joseph, and his brethren, and his father’s house: only their children, and their sheep, and their cattle left they in the land of Goshen.
speaker: Narrator

text: And there went up with him both chariots and horsemen: and they were an exceeding great company.
speaker: Narrator

text: And they came to Goren Atad, which is beyond Jordan, and there they made a great and exceeding sore lamentation: and he mourned for his father seven days.
speaker: Narrator

text: And when the Canaanites the inhabitants of the land saw the mourning in Goren Atad, they said, This is a great mourning unto the Egyptians: wherefore the name thereof was called Abel Mizraim, which is beyond Jordan.
speaker: Narrator

text: So his sons did unto him, according as he had commanded them:
speaker: Narrator

text: For his sons carried him into the land of Canaan, and buried him in the cave of the field of Machpelah, which cave Abraham bought with the field, to be a place to bury in, of Ephron the Hittite beside Mamre.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Joseph returned into Egypt, he and his brethren, and all that went up with him to bury his father, after that he had buried his father.
speaker: Narrator

text: And when Joseph’s brethren saw that their father was dead, they said, It may be that Joseph will hate us, and will pay us again all the evil which we did unto him.
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore they sent unto Joseph, saying, Thy father commanded before his death, saying,
speaker: Narrator

text: Thus shall ye say unto Joseph, Forgive now, I pray thee, the trespass of thy brethren, and their sin: for they rewarded thee evil. And now, we pray thee, forgive the trespass of the servants of thy father’s God. And Joseph wept, when they spake unto him.
speaker: Narrator

text: Also his brethren came unto him, and fell down before his face, and said, Behold, we be thy servants.
speaker: Narrator

text: To whom Joseph said, Fear not: for am not I under God?
speaker: Narrator

text: When ye thought evil against me, God disposed it to good, that he might bring to pass, as it is this day, and save much people alive.
speaker: Narrator

text: Fear not now therefore, I will nourish you, and your children: and he comforted them, and spake kindly unto them.
speaker: Narrator

text: So Joseph dwelt in Egypt, he, and his father’s house: and Joseph lived an hundred and ten years.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Joseph saw Ephraim’s children, even unto the third generation: also the sons of Machir the son of Manasseh were brought upon Joseph’s knees.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Joseph said unto his brethren, I am ready to die, and God will surely visit you, and bring you out of this land, unto the land which he sware unto Abraham, unto Isaac, and unto Jacob.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Joseph took an oath of the children of Israel, saying, God will surely visit you, and ye shall carry my bones hence.
speaker: Narrator

text: So Joseph died, when he was an hundred and ten years old: and they embalmed him, and put him in a chest in Egypt.
speaker: Narrator
